story:
About this project

The physical design of light meters hasn’t changed much in the last few decades. And using a light meter hasn’t changed either - it has always been a very inefficient process.  The photographer carries the meter into the set, takes a measurement, and then returns to fiddle with the lights or camera. And repeat. With all the advances in sensor technology and electronic design, we felt that smartphone infrastructure could be harnessed to create a new, breakthrough meter design that delivers accurate measurements with incredibly improved productivity as well.

We took that idea to photographers and filmmakers to learn more about their needs.  We brainstormed and devised a truly unique light meter.  

  • We included features that would help the photographer get the right exposure and white balance faster – improving productivity on the set and reducing editing time spent fixing exposure and color issues.
  • We made the meter measure light and color, avoiding the need to buy two separate devices.
  • We separated the light sensor from the controls and display, and then replaced the controls & display with a device everyone already carries - a smartphone.  That made the meter smaller, lower cost, and more convenient.
  • We also developed one of the best reasons for photographers to own a smartwatch - providing light and color readings right to your wrist.  That leaves your hands free to adjusts lights, carry your camera, interact with the talent, or whatever else you need to do.  Now the meter can even watch the light while you’re busy, warning you when something important changes.  

The result of all this work is the Illuminati Meter: a compact device for measuring light and color.  But it really functions as your lighting assistant – helping you be more productive, more engaged with your subject. That allows you to concentrate on creating beautiful images.

Whether you create moving or still images the Illuminati light and color meter helps you measure the light in your scene – all kinds of light - efficiently and accurately. The small, lightweight meter is controlled by your smartphone using the Illuminati meter app which will be available for both Apple iOS and Android phones. Color temperature and exposure readings are transmitted from the meter to your smartphone using Bluetooth wireless technology. If you have a smartwatch paired with your smartphone, the meter readings show up there as well for a hands-free metering experience.

The meter measures exposure and color temperature from continuous sources such as LEDs, halogen, HMI, and, of course, the sun. It also measures strobes, giving you the correct exposure and color temperature - and it will even measure strobe duration. It also has a strobe + ambient mode to help you balance the exposure and also the color of the light. You can also connect multiple Illuminati meters to your smartphone and monitor multiple light simultaneously.

The illuminati light and color meter also offers several convenient mounting options including a ¼-20 socket, a lanyard channel, and a rare-earth magnet on the back which can be used with to mount the meter directly to metal objects, or with the set of Illuminati magnetic mounting attachments.

This is the first time all these features have been available in a light metering product at such an attractive price: $249 + shipping on Indiegogo right now.

We’re dedicated to advancing your ability to make your vision come to life with simple, powerful imaging and exposure measurement tools. The Illuminati Wireless Meter is designed to be the most versatile light and color meter ever available. We plan to keep expanding its capabilities beyond the initial release with new app features and firmware updates. This is one gadget you won’t want to leave behind.

If you want to master photography to capture your life, adventures, or for your profession, you need to get your color and exposure right. To get those really great photos, you have to stop shooting under just the ambient light, and really take control. You can't rely on your camera’s automatic options to give the look you want. The Illuminati meter gives all the information you, the modern creator, needs. We save you time and give you the confidence to focus on what matters–your vision.

We hope you agree, and want to join us in the pursuit of amazing photos and video. Continue reading to discover all the features and capabilities of the Illuminati Meter, as well as technical specifications. You can also watch some helpful demo videos made by our team and pro-photographers who’ve had the chance to beta test the meter. Finally, read what the media has to say about Illuminati Meter.

If you have any questions or comments, be sure to contact us. We’re excited to bring our product to you and can’t wait to see how it helps photographers and videographers around the world.


 

"Light makes photography. Embrace light. Admire it. Love it. But above all, know light. Know it for all you are worth, and you will know the key to photography."  

— George Eastman

 

Illuminati Meter plus Android Phone (iOS available, too!)

 

The Illuminati meter is the world's first Bluetooth light and color meter that works wirelessly with smartphones.  

Traditional light meters combine the sensor and display into one bulky device.  The Illuminati meter discards all that extra weight and keeps only the most critical parts.  Small and wireless, you place the Illuminati meter anywhere in your scene.  It sends readings in real time to your phone or smartwatch while you are free to stay behind your camera or adjust lights.

The Illuminati meter can also continuously monitor the ambient lighting and color. User-programmable alarms will warn you if the brightness changes because of a cloud floating overhead or the color temperature changes during the golden hour. Always know your lighting and get more good shots under changing conditions.

The Illuminati meter is also the first system to let you use multiple sensors simultaneously. You can meter foregrounds and backgrounds, set strobe ratios, or monitor and manage multiple light sources (including flash!) or large areas at the same time. Stop wasting valuable time running between lights or scene locations.

You can even use your smartwatch to trigger the meters remotely, monitor readings constantly and receive critical notifications about exposure or color shifts. You can get readings continuously without ever having to take out your phone or put your camera down. We’re first to do that, too!

Best of all, it’s simple to use and small. Check it out:

(Anatomy of an Illuminati meter)

 

No sweat. Here is a video we made in our office in Santa Clara, CA.

Tech Specs

 

  • One (1) Illuminati Bluetooth Light and Color Meter
  • One (1) Storage/Carry Case
  • One (1) Professional version of the Illuminati App ($20 Anticipated Value after Indiegogo)
  • One (1) Offset Finger-T Accessory Clip. Can be rotated to tilt the meter at different angles
  • One (1) Alligator Accessory Clip. Affix to clothes, hook-and-loop straps, etc
  • Two (2) AAA alkaline batteries (TBD)
  • One (1) Instruction card, which includes: How to open battery case & install batteries, App download instructions Link to user manual & website Link to website

We solved a bunch of real-world problems for visual artists, content-creators and professionals

Auto White Balance (AWB) Doesn’t Always Work

(Left: Too cool, Center: Neutral, Right: Too warm)

Letting the camera decide how to set white balance might sound convenient.  But when it fails, you get bad skin tones, inaccurate colors, and even different colors shot-to-shot. Instead, use the Illuminati meter to get the light’s true color temperature and set white balance correctly. Leave automatic color mishaps behind.  Stop wasting time fixing it in Photoshop® or Lightroom® by getting it right before you press the shutter button.  

Wrong Exposures in Tough Lighting Conditions

(Left: Overexposed (lost highlights) Right: Properly exposed)

Autoexposure works fine for typical scenes. Truly creative images aren’t typical. You have to control your camera, not the other way around. Subjects like a bride in a stunning white gown next to a groom in dark tuxedo, or a model backlit or under a spotlight can cause any camera to struggle.  

Measuring the light falling on your subject (incident) instead of bouncing back to the camera (reflected), will let you always nail the exposure. First time, every time.

Unnatural or Unexpected Colors when Mixing Lighting

(Left: Daylight only, Middle: Daylight + Tungsten, Right: Daylight plus matched color balance)

A shot ruined by mixed lighting can be almost impossible to fix when editing your RAW files. If your flash doesn’t match the ambient, you’re bound to get odd shadow colors. A fill light can ruin an otherwise gorgeous golden sunset.  Use the Illuminati meter’s strobe and ambient color measuring to match your strobes to the ambient and avoid mixed color casts.  

Scenes with multiple light sources or odd sources, like LEDs or fluorescent lights, can also be problematic. Measure your sources separately with the Illuminati meter and instantly know how to filter or white balance to get the look you want.  You even can use multiple meters in your scene to do it even faster.

We’re also including a GEL MODE in the app to help you choose the right color correction gels, even for hard-to-match lights like LEDs.

Change Happens

Sometimes a cloud passes before the sun, or one of your flashes stops working. If you don’t know when it happens, you may have to reshoot the photos or just plain loose the shots.  Bummer.  Avoid that with up to 15 user-programmable alarm notifications.  The app can even automatically compare readings from several meters and send you warnings of color changes, color mismatch, or changes in relative brightness. 

 

Your Time is Money

When you’re a pro, all the time spent correcting images afterwards eats into your profit. Get each shot right and spend less time correcting exposure and color.

(© Tony Corbell)

Setting up Lighting Ratios  

Know the exposure difference between your main light and fill or background light. Measure all of them and see the difference in f-stops. It’s easy and fast to set the same ratios up again anywhere.

(© Tony Corbell)

Stay in the Flow

Setting and checking lighting during a photoshoot can detract from the energy between a photographer and her model or clients.  Avoid those, “Hold on a sec, I have to check the lighting…” moments by having the answers in your pocket or on your wrist.  You can also quietly ask assistants to go make adjustments since you already know what to fix!

 

 

Level up as Director of Photography

With multiple Illuminati meters on the set, you can be behind the camera or in the video village while working with your gaffers to craft the lighting.

 

Be the Best Gaffer on Set  

If you’re handling the lights and the DP calls for adjustments for a light in an awkward place (happens, right?), you can place your meter in the sweet spot and clamber up to the light to make changes and see the results on your phone or watch.  Gel the light, adjust the power or adjust the color temperature–you’ll get all the right info, faster.

Change Happens

Save Time when Color Grading   

When the editing is done and you’re grading your footage, you’ll appreciate the exposure and colors all being in the right place. Don’t lose any highlights or shadows to something you could have fixed on set. Measure now with Illuminati meters and spend less time gnashing your teeth during color grading.

Rapid Green Screen Illumination

A badly lit green screen won’t mask out properly.  Using a grid of Illuminati meters in front of your green screen lets you get behind the lights and adjust them while seeing the results in Continuous Mode in the palm of your hand. The LEDs on the meters will show you which areas are too bright or too dark. When all the meters glow green, you’re good to go.

Matching and Correcting Light Sources  

You’ve got many lights on your set. They may be rented and unknown, or from different manufacturers.  Plus, not all lights are made the same (or accurately report or display their color temperature).  On top of that, many bulbs drift color temperature over time with use. Phew!

With the Illuminati meter, you will measure, know and correct all your light sources to match (or tailor to taste) before rolling camera.

 

​

Measure the brightness of both ambient and strobe lighting

  • Measuring modes: Tv, Av, Sv, strobe ratio priority
  • Strobe-to-total ratio is how much of the light comes from the strobe

 

Measure color of both ambient and strobes

  • One meter for both types of readings
  • Helps you detect and correct color differences to prevent mixed lighting, or craft deliberate neutral + warm/cool lighting scenarios

Connect multiple sensors to your phone

 

(Measure the foreground and background simultaneously with multiple meters)

  • Meter large areas to get uniform lighting
  • Measure strobe ratios (foreground/background or main/fill/hair, etc.)
  • Simultaneously measure color of different light sources, e.g. daylight from windows and artificial lighting

Measures color in both color temperature and chromaticity

(Two Chromaticity measurements compared)

  

(Color temperature reading on app)

  • Color temperature is ideal for setting camera white balance and color correcting natural sources
  • Chromaticity helps you color correct artificial sources like LEDs and fluorescents, or other sources that may not emit full chroma spectrum or have a tint

Measures color of strobe and ambient

(Strobe + Ambient Exposure with matched color © Tony Corbell)

  • Helps you detect and correct color differences to prevent mixed lighting

Trigger a meter reading

  • from the app
  • from your watch
  • from button on the meter
  • continuous ambient monitoring

(Trigger the meter from your smartwatch)

Flash Triggering  

  • Strobe photo trigger with automatic preflash rejection
  • Use a sync cable from Illuminati Meter sync port to remotely trigger strobes

Spring-loaded Retractable Dome

  • Dome toggles up/down much like a ballpoint pen cap
  • Dome up for metering people or other 3D objects and multiple light sources at same time
  • Dome down for metering flat objects or single light sources
  • Safety feature: accidental pressure on the dome will push it into meter body instead of cracking.

RGB Status Indicator LEDs on meter face

  • Used for displaying status information - battery warning, BLE connection status, etc.
  • Primarily used to display user-programmable light and color level alarms. The LEDs are a great way to check lighting conditions with even looking at your phone.

Powered by two AAA batteries

  • Battery life is approximately 6 months
  • Easy to find, easy to replace
  • No need to worry about charging an internal or proprietary battery

Custom Alarms warn you when lighting changes

Set up to 15 different alarms per device to monitor any parameter:

  • ambient or strobe light level
  • ambient or strobe color temp
  • ambient or strobe chromaticity coordinates (x or y)

Set any type of limits

  • upper or lower limits
  • within a range
  • outside a range
  • # stops change in brightness

Wireless firmware upgrades

  • You will benefit from all new features and bug fixes

Multiple mounting options

(Magnetic mount in action)

  • ¼-20 tripod mount
  • Holes for lanyard or necklace
  • Rear rare-earth magnet

(All the Magnetic Accessory Prototypes)

Magnetic Accessories  

Any magnetic accessory can be used to clip the meter to a thin surface like curtains, a jacket, shirt, reflector, and more.

Finger T

  • Also doubles as a kickstand to support meter at an angle on a table
  • Hold the meter between two fingers while leaving the rest of your hand free

Offset Finger T

  • Like the Finger T, but better!
  • Rotating the top alters the angle to adjust from 90 deg to 45 deg for standing nearly vertical or at an upward angle

(Using the offset-T to tilt the meter at various angles)

Alligator Clip  

  • Clip firmly to collars, ties, and other clothing
  • Clip to a hook-and-loop strap or cord

Alligator Clip on Jeans Pocket

Tie Loops  

  • Use this when you mount the meter on to a C-Stand, boom arm, pole, or any round objec

(Tie Loops on Strap)

Don't forget the built-in lanyard loop on the meter body!

Indiegogo backers get the Pro version for life (Anticipated Value $20). Retail customers will get Basic version and can purchase Pro version for an additional cost.

Check out our video demo of the app and meter working together.

The current app is a functional prototype.  We have not finalized the user interface.  That's one reason why we need your help!

(Startup screens and video metering)

(Ambient reading screens showing exposure, color temp, and chromaticity)

(Strobe reading screens showing exposure, color temp, and chromaticity)

Manage Multiple Meters

  • Compute multi-meter readings like minimum and maximum readings, average level and more

Video Modes

  • Shutter angles, f-stop, ISO, frame rate (fps)

Photography

  • Aperture, shutter speed, f-stop, ISO

Flash

  • Exposure value (aperture, ISO, f-stop and ISO)
  • Flash-to-ambient ratio

Color Temperature

  • Displays ambient and strobe color temperature individually
  • Slider to set target color temperature. Displays shows the mired color shift.
  • Use the button “Copy reading to target” to quickly pick a reading to use as a reference. Then compare other readings from different lights to the reference light. Good for matching lights.

Chromaticity Plot

  • Shows exact color coordinates of both ambient and strobe in CIE XYZ gamut (entire visible spectrum of light), with a gamut indicator triangle for sRGB
  • Shows not only color temperature, but magenta-green color shift (tint) between lights
  • Great for matching to odd lights like LEDs or fluorescents

Software Development Kit (SDK)

We are planning on releasing an SDK after our backers receive their rewards so that other innovative programmers and hardware developers can do fun and interesting things with the Illuminati Meter. We’re looking forward to what is possible when more minds apply their ideas and creativity in this space.

“As many things have changed in the medium of photography, the one constant element has been light. The quality and color of light in a photograph is what gives meaning and definition to the activity. The direction is what gives the photograph a sense of time and moment, and critical is the difference between the light and shadow. The light meter is still one of the most important tools for creative photographers to use in making their work. The Illuminati meter gives the photographer more information than we have ever had, and ways to use that information that we have only dreamed about.”

— Dennis Keeley, Chair at Art Center College of Design in Pasadena, CA

“I have been promoting the need for and importance of light meters for the past twenty years. Now for the first time, there is finally a new way to measure light and color that is affordable and accurate, with cutting edge technology. Illuminati is here and I for one will use it every day."

— Tony Corbell, Photographer/Lighting Evangelist

“Finally, a photographer’s tool that will change the way you work and simplify precision control with color and exposure using your smart device… the Illuminati. A tool for today’s professional image maker! Measure a range of mixed lighting from ambient to strobe but most important, a wealth of information and control at our fingertips at a reasonable cost."

— Eddie Tapp, M.Photog., MEI, Cr., API Certified Professional Photographer, Explorer of Light - Canon USA, Photoshop Hall of Fame, Certified Drone Pilot, Delkin ImageMaker, Triple Scoop Music, Coloratti - X-Rite, Legion of Lume, DJI Ambassador, Ilford Master Coach

We exhibited a preview of the Illuminati Meter at WPPI 2017.  

This is our first Indiegogo, but it isn’t our first rodeo...

What is ready to go?

We know how to make light meters. Our sister company, Peripheral Vision, designs and sells scientific-grade light and color meters for camera image quality testing. Their products are used by dozens of the best known camera companies all over the world, including Silicon Valley giants.

The Illuminati meter final mechanical design is complete. We already use the same plastics suppliers to make much larger and more complex parts. The electrical design is also complete.

(Exploded view)

We have working Android and Android Wear apps that all our Alpha testers love.  

Also, we’ve patented some major features in the Illuminati Meter and more patents are pending. We’ve made some real breakthroughs during development, and more are on the way.

What is next?

When we ship the meters, the iOS version will be ready for Apple iPhone and iPad owners.

Complete radio EMI/compliance testing Develop the production apps for both iOS and Android Complete production test and calibration.

Why We Need your Help

We’ve spent our own money prototyping the ideas and iterating forward to turn an idea into a real working product. But funding mass production includes making plastic molds, regulatory testing, production testing and calibration processes, retail packaging, app user interface design and coding, and more. These all come at a cost.

By backing our project, we’ll have the proper funds to bring this truly innovative product to you, the people who most believe that possible is worth supporting. Please help us bring the dream to life.

(Development & Production Schedule)

Illuminati Instruments was founded in 2017 by Michael Okincha. Michael designed the electronics and wrote the firmware.

Michael knows how to build cameras. He has worked on all types of cameras - scientific, medical, DSLRs, mobile phone cameras, security, automotive, and video conferencing systems.

He worked in many technical, marketing, and management roles at companies such as Foveon, Agilent, Flextronics, and Omnivision. Michael designed and managed the first camera with Foveon's X3 sensor technology, the Sigma SD9.

In 2010 Michael founded Peripheral Vision (PV), a camera design consulting business. PV has helped over sixty clients, including the largest manufacturers in Silicon Valley, develop products with cameras. PV also develops automated camera test systems. The PV team includes a broad range of skills, including hardware, firmware, software, production testing, color science, and optics.

One of PV's services is camera image quality testing.  As part of that work, PV developed a line of light & color meters, including the Isolight and Puck meters. The Illuminati meter is based on that work.

Rudy Guttosch was raised in a family-owned commercial photography business and spent several years in digital imaging sales and development at Hasselblad USA and its parent company in Sweden. Most recently, he worked at digital image sensor developer Foveon. He holds BS/MS degrees in Imaging Science from Rochester Institute of Technology.

Tom Walker is a product designer with over 25 years experience. Now based in Asia but with extensive experience working with international clients, both Blue Chip and other projects, such as the 3Doodler.

We’ve been working on this for over three years. We’re really confident we can bring this product to market and grateful for your support backing our project or even telling someone you know who loves photography, filmmaking or creating content. We appreciate you!

Our pledge to you: We will communicate openly and honestly about the process with our backer community.

Disclaimer: iPhone, Apple, Apple logo and Android, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Lightroom, Foveon, Agilent, Flextronics, Omnivision, Hasselblad, and 3Doodler are all registered trademarks of their respective owners.

We’re excited to bring our product to you and can’t wait to see how it helps photographers and videographers around the world. "Light makes photography. Embrace light. Admire it. Love it. But above all, know light. Know it for all you are worth, and you will know the key to photography."  — George Eastman Illuminati Meter plus Android Phone (iOS available, too!) The Illuminati meter is the world's first Bluetooth light and color meter that works wirelessly with smartphones.  Traditional light meters combine the sensor and display into one bulky device.  The Illuminati meter discards all that extra weight and keeps only the most critical parts.  Small and wireless, you place the Illuminati meter anywhere in your scene.  It sends readings in real time to your phone or smartwatch while you are free to stay behind your camera or adjust lights.The Illuminati meter can also continuously monitor the ambient lighting and color. User-programmable alarms will warn you if the brightness changes because of a cloud floating overhead or the color temperature changes during the golden hour. Always know your lighting and get more good shots under changing conditions.The Illuminati meter is also the first system to let you use multiple sensors simultaneously. You can meter foregrounds and backgrounds, set strobe ratios, or monitor and manage multiple light sources (including flash!) or large areas at the same time. Stop wasting valuable time running between lights or scene locations.You can even use your smartwatch to trigger the meters remotely, monitor readings constantly and receive critical notifications about exposure or color shifts. You can get readings continuously without ever having to take out your phone or put your camera down. We’re first to do that, too!Best of all, it’s simple to use and small. Check it out:(Anatomy of an Illuminati meter) No sweat. Here is a video we made in our office in Santa Clara, CA.Tech Specs 
One (1) Illuminati Bluetooth Light and Color Meter
One (1) Storage/Carry Case
One (1) Professional version of the Illuminati App ($20 Anticipated Value after Indiegogo)
One (1) Offset Finger-T Accessory Clip. Can be rotated to tilt the meter at different angles
One (1) Alligator Accessory Clip. Affix to clothes, hook-and-loop straps, etc
Two (2) AAA alkaline batteries (TBD)
One (1) Instruction card, which includes: How to open battery case & install batteries, App download instructions Link to user manual & website Link to website
We solved a bunch of real-world problems for visual artists, content-creators and professionalsAuto White Balance (AWB) Doesn’t Always Work(Left: Too cool, Center: Neutral, Right: Too warm)Letting the camera decide how to set white balance might sound convenient.  But when it fails, you get bad skin tones, inaccurate colors, and even different colors shot-to-shot. Instead, use the Illuminati meter to get the light’s true color temperature and set white balance correctly. Leave automatic color mishaps behind.  Stop wasting time fixing it in Photoshop® or Lightroom® by getting it right before you press the shutter button.  Wrong Exposures in Tough Lighting Conditions(Left: Overexposed (lost highlights) Right: Properly exposed)Autoexposure works fine for typical scenes. Truly creative images aren’t typical. You have to control your camera, not the other way around. Subjects like a bride in a stunning white gown next to a groom in dark tuxedo, or a model backlit or under a spotlight can cause any camera to struggle.  Measuring the light falling on your subject (incident) instead of bouncing back to the camera (reflected), will let you always nail the exposure. First time, every time.Unnatural or Unexpected Colors when Mixing Lighting(Left: Daylight only, Middle: Daylight + Tungsten, Right: Daylight plus matched color balance)A shot ruined by mixed lighting can be almost impossible to fix when editing your RAW files. If your flash doesn’t match the ambient, you’re bound to get odd shadow colors. A fill light can ruin an otherwise gorgeous golden sunset.  Use the Illuminati meter’s strobe and ambient color measuring to match your strobes to the ambient and avoid mixed color casts.  Scenes with multiple light sources or odd sources, like LEDs or fluorescent lights, can also be problematic. Measure your sources separately with the Illuminati meter and instantly know how to filter or white balance to get the look you want.  You even can use multiple meters in your scene to do it even faster.We’re also including a GEL MODE in the app to help you choose the right color correction gels, even for hard-to-match lights like LEDs.Change HappensSometimes a cloud passes before the sun, or one of your flashes stops working. If you don’t know when it happens, you may have to reshoot the photos or just plain loose the shots.  Bummer.  Avoid that with up to 15 user-programmable alarm notifications.  The app can even automatically compare readings from several meters and send you warnings of color changes, color mismatch, or changes in relative brightness.  Your Time is MoneyWhen you’re a pro, all the time spent correcting images afterwards eats into your profit. Get each shot right and spend less time correcting exposure and color.(© Tony Corbell)Setting up Lighting Ratios  Know the exposure difference between your main light and fill or background light. Measure all of them and see the difference in f-stops. It’s easy and fast to set the same ratios up again anywhere.(© Tony Corbell)Stay in the FlowSetting and checking lighting during a photoshoot can detract from the energy between a photographer and her model or clients.  Avoid those, “Hold on a sec, I have to check the lighting…” moments by having the answers in your pocket or on your wrist.  You can also quietly ask assistants to go make adjustments since you already know what to fix!  Level up as Director of PhotographyWith multiple Illuminati meters on the set, you can be behind the camera or in the video village while working with your gaffers to craft the lighting. Be the Best Gaffer on Set  If you’re handling the lights and the DP calls for adjustments for a light in an awkward place (happens, right?), you can place your meter in the sweet spot and clamber up to the light to make changes and see the results on your phone or watch.  Gel the light, adjust the power or adjust the color temperature–you’ll get all the right info, faster.Change HappensSave Time when Color Grading   When the editing is done and you’re grading your footage, you’ll appreciate the exposure and colors all being in the right place. Don’t lose any highlights or shadows to something you could have fixed on set. Measure now with Illuminati meters and spend less time gnashing your teeth during color grading.Rapid Green Screen IlluminationA badly lit green screen won’t mask out properly.  Using a grid of Illuminati meters in front of your green screen lets you get behind the lights and adjust them while seeing the results in Continuous Mode in the palm of your hand. The LEDs on the meters will show you which areas are too bright or too dark. When all the meters glow green, you’re good to go.Matching and Correcting Light Sources  You’ve got many lights on your set. They may be rented and unknown, or from different manufacturers.  Plus, not all lights are made the same (or accurately report or display their color temperature).  On top of that, many bulbs drift color temperature over time with use. Phew!With the Illuminati meter, you will measure, know and correct all your light sources to match (or tailor to taste) before rolling camera. ​Measure the brightness of both ambient and strobe lighting
Measuring modes: Tv, Av, Sv, strobe ratio priority
Strobe-to-total ratio is how much of the light comes from the strobe
 Measure color of both ambient and strobes
One meter for both types of readings
Helps you detect and correct color differences to prevent mixed lighting, or craft deliberate neutral + warm/cool lighting scenarios
Connect multiple sensors to your phone (Measure the foreground and background simultaneously with multiple meters)
Meter large areas to get uniform lighting
Measure strobe ratios (foreground/background or main/fill/hair, etc.)
Simultaneously measure color of different light sources, e.g. daylight from windows and artificial lighting
Measures color in both color temperature and chromaticity(Two Chromaticity measurements compared)  (Color temperature reading on app)
Color temperature is ideal for setting camera white balance and color correcting natural sources
Chromaticity helps you color correct artificial sources like LEDs and fluorescents, or other sources that may not emit full chroma spectrum or have a tint
Measures color of strobe and ambient(Strobe + Ambient Exposure with matched color © Tony Corbell)Helps you detect and correct color differences to prevent mixed lightingTrigger a meter reading
from the app
from your watch
from button on the meter
continuous ambient monitoring
(Trigger the meter from your smartwatch)Flash Triggering  
Strobe photo trigger with automatic preflash rejection
Use a sync cable from Illuminati Meter sync port to remotely trigger strobes
Spring-loaded Retractable Dome
Dome toggles up/down much like a ballpoint pen cap
Dome up for metering people or other 3D objects and multiple light sources at same time
Dome down for metering flat objects or single light sources
Safety feature: accidental pressure on the dome will push it into meter body instead of cracking.
RGB Status Indicator LEDs on meter face
Used for displaying status information - battery warning, BLE connection status, etc.
Primarily used to display user-programmable light and color level alarms. The LEDs are a great way to check lighting conditions with even looking at your phone.
Powered by two AAA batteries
Battery life is approximately 6 months
Easy to find, easy to replace
No need to worry about charging an internal or proprietary battery
Custom Alarms warn you when lighting changesSet up to 15 different alarms per device to monitor any parameter:
ambient or strobe light level
ambient or strobe color temp
ambient or strobe chromaticity coordinates (x or y)
Set any type of limits
upper or lower limits
within a range
outside a range
# stops change in brightness
Wireless firmware upgradesYou will benefit from all new features and bug fixesMultiple mounting options(Magnetic mount in action)
¼-20 tripod mount
Holes for lanyard or necklace
Rear rare-earth magnet
(All the Magnetic Accessory Prototypes)Magnetic Accessories  Any magnetic accessory can be used to clip the meter to a thin surface like curtains, a jacket, shirt, reflector, and more.Finger T
Also doubles as a kickstand to support meter at an angle on a table
Hold the meter between two fingers while leaving the rest of your hand free
Offset Finger T
Like the Finger T, but better!
Rotating the top alters the angle to adjust from 90 deg to 45 deg for standing nearly vertical or at an upward angle
(Using the offset-T to tilt the meter at various angles)Alligator Clip  
Clip firmly to collars, ties, and other clothing
Clip to a hook-and-loop strap or cord
Alligator Clip on Jeans PocketTie Loops  Use this when you mount the meter on to a C-Stand, boom arm, pole, or any round objec(Tie Loops on Strap)Don't forget the built-in lanyard loop on the meter body!Indiegogo backers get the Pro version for life (Anticipated Value $20). Retail customers will get Basic version and can purchase Pro version for an additional cost.Check out our video demo of the app and meter working together.The current app is a functional prototype.  We have not finalized the user interface.  That's one reason why we need your help!(Startup screens and video metering)(Ambient reading screens showing exposure, color temp, and chromaticity)(Strobe reading screens showing exposure, color temp, and chromaticity)Manage Multiple MetersCompute multi-meter readings like minimum and maximum readings, average level and moreVideo ModesShutter angles, f-stop, ISO, frame rate (fps)PhotographyAperture, shutter speed, f-stop, ISOFlash
Exposure value (aperture, ISO, f-stop and ISO)
Flash-to-ambient ratio
Color Temperature
Displays ambient and strobe color temperature individually
Slider to set target color temperature. Displays shows the mired color shift.
Use the button “Copy reading to target” to quickly pick a reading to use as a reference. Then compare other readings from different lights to the reference light. Good for matching lights.
Chromaticity Plot
Shows exact color coordinates of both ambient and strobe in CIE XYZ gamut (entire visible spectrum of light), with a gamut indicator triangle for sRGB
Shows not only color temperature, but magenta-green color shift (tint) between lights
Great for matching to odd lights like LEDs or fluorescents
Software Development Kit (SDK)We are planning on releasing an SDK after our backers receive their rewards so that other innovative programmers and hardware developers can do fun and interesting things with the Illuminati Meter. We’re looking forward to what is possible when more minds apply their ideas and creativity in this space.“As many things have changed in the medium of photography, the one constant element has been light. The quality and color of light in a photograph is what gives meaning and definition to the activity. The direction is what gives the photograph a sense of time and moment, and critical is the difference between the light and shadow. The light meter is still one of the most important tools for creative photographers to use in making their work. The Illuminati meter gives the photographer more information than we have ever had, and ways to use that information that we have only dreamed about.”— Dennis Keeley, Chair at Art Center College of Design in Pasadena, CA“I have been promoting the need for and importance of light meters for the past twenty years. Now for the first time, there is finally a new way to measure light and color that is affordable and accurate, with cutting edge technology. Illuminati is here and I for one will use it every day."— Tony Corbell, Photographer/Lighting Evangelist“Finally, a photographer’s tool that will change the way you work and simplify precision control with color and exposure using your smart device… the Illuminati. A tool for today’s professional image maker! Measure a range of mixed lighting from ambient to strobe but most important, a wealth of information and control at our fingertips at a reasonable cost."— Eddie Tapp, M.Photog., MEI, Cr., API Certified Professional Photographer, Explorer of Light - Canon USA, Photoshop Hall of Fame, Certified Drone Pilot, Delkin ImageMaker, Triple Scoop Music, Coloratti - X-Rite, Legion of Lume, DJI Ambassador, Ilford Master CoachWe exhibited a preview of the Illuminati Meter at WPPI 2017.  This is our first Indiegogo, but it isn’t our first rodeo...What is ready to go?We know how to make light meters. Our sister company, Peripheral Vision, designs and sells scientific-grade light and color meters for camera image quality testing. Their products are used by dozens of the best known camera companies all over the world, including Silicon Valley giants.The Illuminati meter final mechanical design is complete. We already use the same plastics suppliers to make much larger and more complex parts. The electrical design is also complete.(Exploded view)We have working Android and Android Wear apps that all our Alpha testers love.  Also, we’ve patented some major features in the Illuminati Meter and more patents are pending. We’ve made some real breakthroughs during development, and more are on the way.What is next?When we ship the meters, the iOS version will be ready for Apple iPhone and iPad owners.Complete radio EMI/compliance testing Develop the production apps for both iOS and Android Complete production test and calibration.Why We Need your HelpWe’ve spent our own money prototyping the ideas and iterating forward to turn an idea into a real working product. But funding mass production includes making plastic molds, regulatory testing, production testing and calibration processes, retail packaging, app user interface design and coding, and more. These all come at a cost.By backing our project, we’ll have the proper funds to bring this truly innovative product to you, the people who most believe that possible is worth supporting. Please help us bring the dream to life.(Development & Production Schedule)Illuminati Instruments was founded in 2017 by Michael Okincha. Michael designed the electronics and wrote the firmware.Michael knows how to build cameras. He has worked on all types of cameras - scientific, medical, DSLRs, mobile phone cameras, security, automotive, and video conferencing systems.He worked in many technical, marketing, and management roles at companies such as Foveon, Agilent, Flextronics, and Omnivision. Michael designed and managed the first camera with Foveon's X3 sensor technology, the Sigma SD9.In 2010 Michael founded Peripheral Vision (PV), a camera design consulting business. PV has helped over sixty clients, including the largest manufacturers in Silicon Valley, develop products with cameras. PV also develops automated camera test systems. The PV team includes a broad range of skills, including hardware, firmware, software, production testing, color science, and optics.One of PV's services is camera image quality testing.  As part of that work, PV developed a line of light & color meters, including the Isolight and Puck meters. The Illuminati meter is based on that work.Rudy Guttosch was raised in a family-owned commercial photography business and spent several years in digital imaging sales and development at Hasselblad USA and its parent company in Sweden. Most recently, he worked at digital image sensor developer Foveon. He holds BS/MS degrees in Imaging Science from Rochester Institute of Technology.Tom Walker is a product designer with over 25 years experience. Now based in Asia but with extensive experience working with international clients, both Blue Chip and other projects, such as the 3Doodler.We’ve been working on this for over three years. We’re really confident we can bring this product to market and grateful for your support backing our project or even telling someone you know who loves photography, filmmaking or creating content. We appreciate you!Our pledge to you: We will communicate openly and honestly about the process with our backer community.Disclaimer: iPhone, Apple, Apple logo and Android, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Lightroom, Foveon, Agilent, Flextronics, Omnivision, Hasselblad, and 3Doodler are all registered trademarks of their respective owners.

story:
The FMJ was created to provide an even better experience when using your handheld 'Pistol Grip' gimbal. Gimbal stabilizers have equipped filmmakers of all levels to accomplish smooth cinematic shots with ease.  But what if you also needed to attach an external monitor to see the fine details, a microphone to capture those ambient sounds while filming, or an LED light for those all too common low light situations? Introducing the Full Metal Jacket Universal Gimbal Mount.

The Full Metal Jacket Gimbal Mount is made from aerospace grade aluminum and engineered into a single uni-body design for increased strength. There are 4 quarter inch mounting locations at the top, bottom, center left, and center right offering a variety of mounting options.
The FMJ is a universal mounting attachment with the ability to fit the majority of handheld gimbals with a quarter inch female configuration at the bottom. The fastening cap that secures the FMJ to the gimbal also offers a quarter inch female configuration allowing you to CONTINUE to use tripod for balancing or resting in between shots. Lastly, the FMJ has been bead blasted for a smooth finish and anodized Black.

The Sniper Gimbal Grip is made from a highly durable industrial grade silicone that is skin safe, extremely comfortable, impact resistant, and easy to clean. A 550 type 3 military paracord adjustable wristband is fastened securely at the bottom of the grip offering the user a 2nd chance in the event of an accidental drop.

The Sniper seamlessly and quickly assembles without any tools or excessive parts, protecting the handle of your Zhiyun Crane Version 2, while simultaneously providing more comfort, but maintaining functionality and usability. Attached to a military strength paracord wrist strap, the Sniper grips the Zhiyun Crane Version 2 to safely secure your gimbal to your wrist. Since our initial design, we have gone through multiple revisions to improve the quality of Sniper.

                                                                                       

FMJ IDEA STAGE

3D PRINTED PROTOTYPES OF FMJ & SNIPER

FMJ - WORKING METAL PROTOTYPE

(AEROSPACE ALUMINUM)

SNIPER WORKING SILICONE PROTOTYPE W/ 550 MILITARY PARACORD WRISTBAND

Concept, design, and creation were all major hurdles and obstacles along the way of finally producing a functional sample of the Sniper. Although there seemed to be endless headaches at times, persistence and a relentless desire to make this dream a reality was all the fuel we needed to see this project to its current stage. Currently ready for production, we now ask the Indiegogo community along with the Pistol Grip Gimbal/Zhiyun product supporters, to assist us in raising the necessary capital to create the molds needed to mass produce this product and make it available and affordable to those of us who love the Zhiyun Crane Version 2 Gimbal but want to comfortably and securely protect our investments with a rugged yet stylish accessory.

 

We've invested a great amount of time planning, designing, and prototyping to ensure we are providing you with well thought out tools that offer value and enhance your filming experience. Please support our campaign TODAY so we can bring The Sniper Gimbal Grip and The Full Metal Jacket Gimbal Mount to market.

The Sniper & Full Metal Jacket - Where Comfort, Protection, And Utility Meet.

story:
Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)

1. What is the effective range of WiFi reception from the Sensor Head to the SmartDevice?

Wide open ranges in testing exceeded 120 feet. But the realistic expected operating range of reception is 80 feet.

2. Do you have to tie into another WiFi network?

No. The Hindsight WiFi Network is "stand-alone" and unique to the unit. It is established on system boot, a process that takes seconds once the sensor head is turned on.

3. What temperature range can the base units operate at?

From -20 deg. C. to 40 deg C. (-4 F. to 104 F.) The key to good adhesion is a clean, dry, smooth surface. Below freezing, the target surface must be cleaned with a dry cloth. Any surface moisture will defeat adhesion with the PU Super-Sticky Pads. Of course, the neodymium magnets hold on any ferrous surface regardless of moisture. We have found that if a warm base unit is placed quickly on a cold surface, PU adhesion is good and dependable.

4. Can the Hindsight System be stolen and used by the thief?

The base units have been shown to exert over 22 lbs of holding strength. The Sensor Head weighs just under 0.5 lbs. That's over 40X its weight in "holding power".  Yes, a base unit can be removed by very determined force. But so can your mirrors! The good news here is that when owners configure their Hindsight Unit for the first time, they will be prompted to generate their own unique WPA2 encrypted password. Unless, the thief knows the password, the Hindsight Unit remains non-functional!

5. Is there a warranty on the Hindsight?

Yes. A one-year manufacturers' warranty protection. Free from manufacturing defects.

6. What guarantees does a backer have of the Hindsight's success?

As you can determine when you read about Our Team, this is a mature group of engineers with a solid business background. Success has been a hallmark of each of these individual's long careers. Rest assured that everything has been well thought out and planned for. Even contingencies.

7. Where is the Hindsight made?

North America. Suppliers and Workers.

8. Where can I get more info?

Head over to our website at

http://www.4sightsystems.org

There's more to see there!

story:
Do you also think that we live in a beautiful world?

I do! That is why I'm so passionate about photography, and especially MACRO photography. 
My name is Jelena Kuznecova, I'm a 29 y.o. young woman. I love to write, and observe the woorld with to wide opened eyes that love to find hidden beauties and immortalize them on the camera.
The inside out Macro Photography project will bring all the small things in a big format.


My Flickr account will be always updated with new macro pictures showing things that normally you wouldn't see by just passing by.

I live in Italy and I move a lot around it and love to travel around the world. My cameras are always with me. You can be part of it too! 
All the beautiful pictures on my Flickr account https://www.flickr.com/photos/bimbafragola/
and on my Pinterest "My Pictures" wall https://www.pinterest.com/bimbafragola/pictures-i-make/


Get the print and a postcard!

There are some goodies I will be sending to you if you choose one of my perks... the choise is up to you!
  • A Thank you Postcard - I will sign and send to you.
  • A Print on Celllulosa Cardboard support 50x70cm - you'll choose tone of my pics and I'll send it to you
  • A Print on PVC 5mm support 70x100cm - you'll choose tone of my pics and I'll send it to you
You can decide to choose one or more of my perks.


A few years ago I boought an awesome compact Nikon camera, that is my mate and compagnon in this picture adventure.
Now the time has come to step to the next level as even a good compact camera has huge limits. Even if it gets close enough, but it's not what I see. An "ok" result is not OK for me. With the new camera and a Marcro lens the results will be breathtaking!

If I reach my crowdfunding campaign goal I'll get the following:
Nikon D7100 body and a Sigma Lens 105mm

My pictures will be all viewed on my flickr public profile and shared on social media as my goal and dream is spread the MAGIC!

Thank you for supporting me and helping my DREAM become a REALITY!

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

 
  • Wir sind ein junges Filmteam, welches sich schon seit einiger Zeit mit dem Medium Film beschäftigt. 
  • Da wir unsere Produktion auf dem uns höchstmöglichen Niveau vollziehen möchten, benötigen wir Ihre Unterstützung für hochwertige Filmtechnik, wie einer Cinema Kamera und Lichttechnik.
 

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

 
  • Wir benötigen 2000€, um dieses Projekt ausführen zu können. 
  • Von diesem Geld würden wir uns Technik mieten und Benzin bezahlen.
  • Siehe Perks

Warum Sie uns unterstützen sollten?

  • Uns liegt dieses Projekt sehr am Herzen, da wir einen großen Teil unserer Freizeit hineininvestieren und wir denken, dass es an der Zeit ist, von der anderen Seite des Mobbings zu berichten
  • Wir haben bereits zwei Kurzfilme gedreht, doch dieses Mal wollen wir das Niveau erhöhen
story_txt:
Kurzbeschreibung 
Wir sind ein junges Filmteam, welches sich schon seit einiger Zeit mit dem Medium Film beschäftigt. 
Da wir unsere Produktion auf dem uns höchstmöglichen Niveau vollziehen möchten, benötigen wir Ihre Unterstützung für hochwertige Filmtechnik, wie einer Cinema Kamera und Lichttechnik.
 
Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst 
Wir benötigen 2000€, um dieses Projekt ausführen zu können. 
Von diesem Geld würden wir uns Technik mieten und Benzin bezahlen.
Siehe Perks


Warum Sie uns unterstützen sollten?

Uns liegt dieses Projekt sehr am Herzen, da wir einen großen Teil unserer Freizeit hineininvestieren und wir denken, dass es an der Zeit ist, von der anderen Seite des Mobbings zu berichten
Wir haben bereits zwei Kurzfilme gedreht, doch dieses Mal wollen wir das Niveau erhöhen

story:
Your contribution with us is a  guaranteed purchase, That means if you order a Nu Grip 4in1 with us, you will get the Nu Grip 4in1, guaranteed.  Your Nu Grip 4in1 is already in production!

 

Nu Grip 4 in 1 - The World's First Floating Tripod for your Action Camera and Smartphone

"We love travelling and capturing our memories with our action camera and our smartphone  but we always found we had to take 3 or 4 different accessories with us. We thought it would be a good idea if we could have ONE grip that would combine all the different functions and be affordable. "  

Nu Grip is a versatile grip and stable tripod, that extends to 22.25 inches / 565mm and it floats in water! Its innovative patent-pending tripod system allows you to capture hands-free underwater shots. 

Versatile floating tripod. Nu Bear’s patent-pending technology allows Nu Grip 4 in 1 to float. Its three independent legs help bring stability when it is in the water and so ideal for capturing underwater footage. The orange high visibility feet make it easy to spot at the surface.

Nu grip floating in a swimming pool with the DJI Osmo Action.

 

 

David Manning - Photographer & YouTube Reviewer   YouTube  Instagram

Mitch Bergsma 'MicBergsma'- YouTuber and GoPro Ambassador   YouTube  Instagram

"This is the pole I have been dreaming of! The floating feature is what seals the deal for me. No other pole out there that has all the features of the Nu Grip AND floats! It is a must-have accessory for my GoPro. I have been wishing for a pole like this for a long time. Will be recommending it to everyone." - Mitch Bergsma 'MicBergsma',

 

Lightest of its kind. At 140g / 4.9 oz Nu Grip 4 in 1 is the lightest of its kind, comfortable in your hand with a textured handle and a bright orange end that can be seen easily. The grip has a standard GoPro attachment. Quickly and easily attach the camera to Nu Grip. There is also a hand wrist lanyard with an adjustable slider lock.  

Explore the ocean and swim with dolphins without the fear of losing your action camera or iPhone!

Use Nu Grip 4 in 1 as an extended pole or grip and capture those incredible underwater shots.

Effortlessly extends. With a simple ‘twist’ and ‘pull’ Nu Grip 4 in 1 can be transformed into an extendable pole. it glides to 22.25 inches in less than a second. 

Stable and sturdy. Quick and easy to set up, the 9-inch grip folds out to a stable tripod. Each orange highly visible foot has a rubber pad for extra grip.

 

Don't worry Nu Grip floats with the ProShot waterproof iPhone case so you can still capture those amazing memories with your cell phone.

ProShot Case- Advanced Underwater iPhone Housing:

  • Waterproof to 50 feet/15 meters
  • Free ProShot Camera App for Underwater filming

​

 

Multi-use Design. Nu Grip was designed with GoPro and DJI in mind but it floats with more than 25 different cameras!

 

    Added security. Nu Grip has an integrated attachment point for the lanyard we provide, so you can secure Nu Grip to your wrist.

    Take it everywhere. Nu Grip 4 in 1 is super lightweight, slimline and compact. It comfortably packs into the pocket of any rucksack or bag, without adding noticeable weight.

    Intuitive. The orange symbols show you which way to unlock and lock the tripod.

    Magnets embedded into the legs keep the legs together in the required grip position.​

    Non - slip.  Rubber feet give the tripod extra stability on slippery surfaces.

    Floating tripod legs. Nu Grip opens up the opportunity to let go and capture new and exciting photos and videos, the NEW underwater selfie without a pole! Nu Grip's tripod legs stabilise the movement of your camera in the water, whilst the GoPro's Hypersmooth 1.0 & 2.0 removes those jerky movements in the water with over capture.

     

    Nick Hearn - Photographer, GoPro Awarded Photographer, Instagram 

    “I’ve been using the Nu Grip for a couple of weeks and it instantly became my favorite mount. It’s perfect for any situation, whether you’re in or out of the water. Being an all-in-one selfie stick, grip, tripod, and floaty, it’s really the only camera accessory you need!” - Nick Hearn,

    Niko Passudetti - Content creator, GoPro Awarded Photographer , Instagram 

    “I'm very happy to share a world preview of a new and wonderful product for your GoPro! Nu Grip 4in1 is a pole with 4 different functions in 1. It is an extendible pole, a tripod, a float and for the GoPro Max it is an invisible pole!” - Niko

     

     

    Accessorise. Nu Grip 4 in 1 is ideal for vlogging as it is very lightweight and super stable. You can easily mount a vlogging kit with a microphone and LED light. 

     

    We are conscious of the impact we are having on our oceans, especially the ever-increasing plastic waste and its devastating effect on marine wildlife. We want to be as socially responsible as we can with our product, packaging, and shipping.

    Nu Grip has been designed with this in mind and the product and its packaging are completely recyclable. We are minimising energy use from initial creation through to shipping. We are dedicated to engaging in an environment-friendly packaging production process, with no single-use plastics. We actively designed our packaging to omit plastic trays, clear plastic windows to display our product, plastic hanging tags, and vacuum-sealed packaging. All our packaging can be recycled. ​

    Of course, there is always more we can do, so we will constantly look at improving our design and manufacturing processes to minimise the environmental footprint. We are happy to announce that we have partnered with ONETREEPLANTED, an organisation focused on reforestation and are committing to planting one tree for every Nu Grip 4 in 1 we sell. We will also plant a tree for those who perhaps don't want to buy a Nu Grip but still want to contribute to the campaign.               

     

    Design Development. We spent the last two years designing, developing and testing Nu Grip and getting crucial user feedback that helped us develop the product further. We started with concept sketches and then detailed CAD design drawings and then bought a 3D printer to create initial prototypes that we could physically hold and test. 

     

    Early Prototypes.  Many prototypes were rigorously tested and given to the Action Camera community to gain valuable user feedback before finalising the design. 

                                    

    Engineering Drawings. 3D CAD Design.

    Injection Mould Tools. Mould tools designed & manufactured and tested for mass production.

     

    Team Nu Bear.  Nu Grip 4 in 1 is designed by husband and wife team, Richard and Basmah, who both studied Industrial Design and Technology at Loughborough University in the UK. They set up the Nu Bear design studio in 2017.

    Together they have over 25 years of design experience and specialise in Industrial Design,  set and event design for a variety of different sectors, including Aviation, Film and Live Events. 

    Richard has designed aircraft interiors for both luxury and commercial aircraft. He has built a reputation for delivering conceptual design right through to viable working products.

    Basmah crafted her skills in the design for Live Events and Film. She was part of the design team for the London 2012 Olympic Ceremonies and more recently has worked on the latest James Bond Film 'No Time to Die' (2020) and the Agatha Christie Films, 'Murder on the Orient Express' (2017) and 'Death on the Nile' (2020).

    With a passion for travel, photography and the water, their idea for Nu Grip started over 2 years ago and they could see that no one else had thought of designing a 4 in 1 product for the action camera community. Instead of packing lots of different accessories, all you needed was 1 accessory. They have spent that time designing, prototyping, testing, and preparing it ready for production. 

     

     

     

    If you know someone who loves photography, action cameras and smartphones or anyone that would be interested in hearing about Nu Grip 4 in 1, we would love you to help share our campaign with them. Use the links below or simply copy and paste the URL above and share it any way you like. You can also use the Indiegogo share tools to help - (they are located in the toolbar next to the campaign's Pitch video.) 

     ​

    For Press inquiries about Nu Grip or this Indiegogo campaign please email design@nu-bear.com or download our Media Kit.

     

    It has been an exciting journey to get here and we now feel Nu Grip 4 in 1 is ready for the world.

    Indiegogo is a supportive platform for tech and design innovations, especially startups like ourselves.  It is a great place to gain exposure from creative people and build a brilliant community.

    It is your support and encouragement that will take Nu Grip and Nu Bear to the next stage, bringing Nu Grip 4 in 1 to market. The funds we generate on Indiegogo make it possible for us to move forward.

    Check out the early bird rewards and our unique perks.

     

     

    Your support means the world to us and thank you for coming along on the journey with us so far. We may be a small business but we have big ideas and you are our greatest supporters for which we are truly grateful. 

    There is a massively long list of people we'd love to thank that helped us turn our idea for Nu Grip 4 in 1 into a reality. We are so grateful for your support, kindness, generosity and encouragement and none of this would have been possible without you. You know who you are! We are truly thankful.  

     

    During these difficult times, there are always unknowns for the future but we have made it our priority to develop the best quality product we can and ensure we mitigate any risks and obstacles.  We promise to give you full transparency should any issues occur and we will be dedicated to solving them as quickly and as efficiently as possible. We want our Backers to be happy and proud to support Nu Grip 4 in 1. 

    Some of the risks we may come across are in the supply chain and the shipping schedule.  Our production tooling is already made and tested and we have spent the last 6 months refining our processes so production can run as smoothly as possible. That being said, we are in a global pandemic, which could affect the delivery of the product and increase the time it takes to send out to customers. However, we are in touch with our manufacturer on a daily basis and we will give regular updates to our Backers.

    ---------------------------------------------------------------------

    Return policy.  Indiegogo is a platform that allows creators to showcase their product ideas at a discounted price.  This price is a pre-order for our product.  The funds raised throughout our campaign will be used to manufacture Nu Grip 4 in 1, resulting in a product the backer can use and enjoy.  In accordance with Indiegogo Terms of Use we will not offer refunds or return for items that are not defective. However, in the event that you receive a faulty item, you are welcome to contact us at Hello@nu-bear.com.   

    Global Shipping.  We are excited to be offering international shipping.  Please note we are not responsible for additional duty and taxes that may apply to your local importation laws.

story:
The Save Jaded Images Sanity Campaign!

Ok a little over dramatic maybe but hey as I'm guessing most of you reading this actually know me... then you know that's me through and through if I'm excited about something!  And who doesn't get excited about Shiny things!

For anyone that DOESN'T know me and has found this randomly:

  • Hi I'm Mark, I live in North Wales UK and I'm a photographer
  • I am known as Jaded Images if you want to check out my work
  • I specialise in Event Photography, Live Music, Product work & Modelling
  • I live with my girlfriend Laura, our cat Jinxy in beautiful North Wales

So.  Why am I here and what do I want/need?  Well that's the easy part:

What I Need & What You Might Get!

Right so basically in June the amazing game that is No Mans Sky comes out on the PS4.   There is just one problem with that - I don't have a PS4!

Can you see where this is going now?  So Here's the deal.  At the moment any spare money we have is going on bills,  and going towards redecorating the house which is a huge project and LONG overdue and as such I haven't had anywhere near enough money for a new console and am not likely to have it spare for some time either, Laura thinks it's a waste of money, but has said if I can raise the money by my own means then fair enough - so here I am!  

And this is what I'm hoping to raise money for:

  • A PS4 system and controllers to play yummy gaming goodness!
  • Enough money for No Mans Sky and maybe a couple of other games?
  • If by any miracle I raise more than I need it will be split between one of the charities we support & going  towards decorating the house so Laura doesn't castrate me or anything

So what's in it for you?

Good Question!  Over the last few years I have done multiple jobs and favours for people regarding photos. interviews, reviews, and PR for as little as possible and in some cases for free so I'm hoping some of those people would like to repay the favour and donate a little no matter how small - every little helps!

BUT for everyone else I am adding a range of perks ranging from Prints of my work to bargain priced photoshoots to just coming & hanging out and playing games lol 

What if no one donates?

Well obviously I'm kinda expecting this to happen, whether anyone helps or not or takes advantage of the seriously cheap shoots on offer is another thing.   If I raise most of the money but not enough I might be able add to it myself to get a PS4, if I raise a little but not a lot then I will give up on the dream and just donate whatever was raised to one of the charities we support.

But nothing ventured nothing gained - And realistically this is the only way I am going to be able to raise money to get a PS4, cannot justify it otherwise, so thank you thank you thank you in advance to ANYONE who donates/helps/supports.

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are hard of course and I know a lot of  people just can't contribute, & thats fine - but that doesn't mean you can't help if you wanted!

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my dream!
  • Remember you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.  THANK YOU!

story:
Start recording back in time and Never Miss a Moment Again!

                     

The Roader Time Machine Camera captures moments that occurred before you touch the record button. It is storing footage in its buffer memory for 10 seconds and flushes it constantly. Once you touch the camera, it creates a clip that stars 10 seconds before you touched it, till 10 seconds after. The 20 seconds clip is then automatically uploaded to your phone. Easy as that!

 

 

 

"I wish I had a video of that!"

Most cameras give you only two options: record everything and spend hours editing the raw footage; or worse, miss that special moment because you can’t grab the camera fast enough. Not anymore.

Roader is storing video in a short time memory and does not record anything until you press the camera. When you press it, a video clip is saved that starts 10 seconds back in time. Using the 10-second video that is stored in the short time memory and adding 10 seconds after you pressed the camera.

You can even broadcast your experiences Live using Youtube Live or Facebook Live and keep your phone in your pocket.

  

 

 

 

 

 "Time machine camera means you'll never miss the moment" 

   "Roader Is the Wearable Camera You Control" 

  "Missed a moment? This camera goes back in time with a quick click" 

  "GoPro should have invented this, but didn’t. It took a small team in the Netherlands to come up with the idea and bring it to CES" 

 

 

 

When Roader is powered on, it starts buffering video in its RAM memory. The image is stored for 10 seconds and it refreshes constantly. Only when you press the camera it saves a file out of its RAM memory (10 seconds) to the internal flash memory and it adds 10 seconds after the press.

The recording of 20 seconds (video+sound) is then automatically transferred to your phone via Bluetooth. Uploading the SD (Social Definition 720x540p) clip via Bluetooth takes approximately 10 seconds and you can immediately share your video from the Roader App to any social channel (like Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Whatsapp, Wechat etc.) or store it in your camera roll.

Another recording of the same moment is stored on the camera in HD (1280x960) and ready to upload to your phone via WiFi when you choose to do so.

 

 

Working with the App

After a clip is created and sent over to your phone, you can easily select the moment you would like to share. Review it and when you want, simply use the editor to trim or enhance it. When ready, just press share and select the Social Channel from the screen. Ready and GO!

 

For Big Screen viewing in HD

An HD (1280x960p) version of your clip is always stored in the camera's memory. When you want to download the HD clip, simply choose the appropriate SD version and press HD. A WiFi connection is set up for the purpose and the HD file is downloaded to your phone. Below the clip, you will see the indication HD appear showing you that the HD version is on your phone. After downloading the HD file, the WiFi connection is shut down to save energy.

 

Wearing and charging Roader is easy with the patent pending Power Lanyard. The Power Lanyard has a USB-C connector on both sides that connect to the wooden block. When the cable is connected to a power supply, the internal battery is charged so you always have the charging cable with you. It is also possible to use the cable for downloading video clips from Roader to a computer. The Roader Indiegogo special ships with a dark grey Power Lanyard. A multiple color pack of 5 Power Lanyards is available with the special perk.

With the optional Car Dock and RF Remote control, Roader can be used as a Car Camera or Dashcam. Easily fit the Suction Cup mount onto the windscreen and connect the power cable. When docked into the Car Mount, Roader is ready to record Events when triggered with the remote control or by G-Sensor Crash Detection. A clip of -10 to +10 seconds is created and automatically sent over to a connected phone. On top of that, Roader starts recording in HD constantly when docked. The constant recordings are split into 3 minutes clips that can be accessed when using the Roader App or when connected to a computer by a cable.

 

Watch a sample clip of a Road(er) Trip in France. (please note: Video compressed by Vimeo. Original MP4 files on request)

 

 

 

We have spent two years developing the product and App and are almost ready to start mass production. Our team and contract manufacturer in China are currently working on the production toolings and final assembly. Our App team is finishing the iOS version and starts creating the Android App. We ask you, backers, to help us raise the funds for the first production run and finishing the App development. 

 

 

 

Sjoerd Pitstra - CoFounder & CEO

Electronics Engineer since 1994 - Entrepreneur in Electronics development, distribution and online retail. Founder of Pitstar Mobile Electronics, ebleep.com, Pitstar Pacific Hong Kong.

 

 

Joost Godee - CoFounder & CDO 

Product Designer and Executive Creative Director - Winner of numerous awards like iF, red dot and IDEA. Worked at frog Design, IDEO, Smart Design, Philips, and Microsoft. Designed for companies like HP, Acer, Shell, GM, Tupperware, Palm, Flip Video, Mazda, GM, Ford USA, and many more.

In addition to our core team, we have assembled a great team of engineers, designers, and experts who are collaborating with us to create the best product possible. We work together with a very experienced contract manufacturer with the capacity to build hundreds of thousands of cameras, a month.

 

  • Product name: Roader Time Machine Camera
  • Video Processor: Ambarella A12
  • Flash Memory: 16GB integrated
  • Image Sensor: Sony Exmor
  • Lens: 120º angle
  • Battery: 2350 mAh Panasonic
  • Battery Life: 7 hours
  • Charge time: 3 hours
  • Connections: Wifi, Bluetooth, USB-C

 

  • Roader Time Machine Camera
  • Power Lanyard USB-C in Dark Grey
  • USB-C to USB adaptor

 

Car Dock (available as part of perk)

  • Suction Cup Windscreen Mount
  • RF Remote control and battery
  • Power cable USB-C to USB 12ft/3.6m
  • USB cig. lighter adaptor

Lanyard Pack (5pcs)(available as part of perk)

  • Green Power Lanyard
  • Silver Power Lanyard
  • Red Power Lanyard
  • Blue Power Lanyard
  • Pink Power Lanyard

Is it easy to use Roader?

Yes, super easy. You switch Roader on by pressing the on/off switch on the bottom of the camera. It boots in 5 seconds so you can use it immediately.

How is Roader different that an Action Cam like GoPro?

Roader is designed for taking video of just relevant and exciting moments. Not hours of video that can be boring and hard to select the right moments. Also, the Social Definition recording resolution is optimized for Social Sharing. The technology we designed and the power management we use, allows Roader to be with you to witness everything for 7 hours on a charge. An Action Cam consumes much more power and will last for 1-2 hours on a battery charge. Action Cams also create huge files that are way to large for social sharing and quick upload.

How do I charge Roader?

Roader comes with the Power Lanyard. The cable for wearing it around your neck is also a charging cable. It has a USB-C connector on both ends so you can charge it easily. Charging takes 3-4 hours and the battery status is indicated by the LED ring on the front of the camera. You can also see the battery level in the App. While using Roader and the battery level drops below 15%, you will receive a notification on your phone indicating the status. This will also happen at 5%.

I do not have a USB-C charger, how to charge?

An adaptor from USB-C to USB-A (standard USB) is supplied with Roader in the box.

Is the image stable when I walk?

We have added an Electronic Image Stabilisation that stabilizes the image digitally. That works very well but to a certain extent. It gives a very realistic image of the moment. Heavy shaking cannot entirely be compensated. For further stabilization, we are planning to add an option to the App at a later stage.

Can I take out the memory card?

Roader is equipped with an onboard memory of 16GB. Plenty of capacity for more than 500 clips in the two resolutions SD (Social Definition) and HD (High Definition). 

When Roader is disconnected from my phone, does it still record?

Yes. All recordings are stored on the internal memory in both resolutions. Once you reconnect, you will see in the App that you have unsynced clips indicating the number. You can then choose to download them and a Wifi connection is set up and the clips are uploaded to your phone.

Why wouldn’t I use my phone for video recording?

Modern phones have excellent cameras. The significant advantage of Roader is that it records already the last 10 seconds (in the buffer) and you initiate to record after you realize something special happened. At that point, you are most likely too late in taking your phone and start a recording. So you miss the moment. Another advantage is that Roader records in a 120º wide angle while most phones are below 60º.

Does it record sound?

Yes, Roader has a built-in microphone.

Can I also record continuously?

In Car Mode, when you put Roader in the Car Dock, it switches automatically to continuous loop recording in 3 minute files. With the wireless remote control that comes with the Car Dock, you can also trigger Event recordings (-10s to +10s) that are automatically uploaded to your phone, just like the wearable mode.

Does it support Live Stream?

Yes, you can set up a Live Stream to Youtube Live and Facebook Live. It will stream via your phone but does not make a recording.

What kind of Memory card do I need?

You do not need one, Roader has a built-in memory of 16GB. Suitable for more than 500 recordings in SD+HD.

Can Roader also take still images?

Yes, when the video is uploaded to your phone, you can select a frame to use as a still image and store it in your camera roll. 

How do I get an HD recording of my video?

The SD version is automatically uploaded to a connected smartphone. When you want the HD version, that stays on the camera, you just select the clip from within the Roader app and press HD. At that moment a WiFi connection is set up between your camera and smartphone for downloading the HD version. Then the clip is indicated with HD in the App. After this download, the WiFi connection will be shut down automatically to save energy.

Does Roader has GPS?

When you trigger an Event Recording, the location of your phone will be added to the file. So in the App, you will then see the location of the recording. We did not integrate GPS in the camera as it consumes a lot of power and reduces battery life.

What kind of battery is used?

We have selected a premium quality Panasonic battery with a capacity of 2350 mAh. 

Do you also have different mounts?

We are planning to supply a tripod and bike mount. Depending on requests of customers, we will develop other mounts.

 

hello@roader.com

Media: press@roader.com
story_txt:
Start recording back in time and Never Miss a Moment Again!
                     
The Roader Time Machine Camera captures moments that occurred before you touch the record button. It is storing footage in its buffer memory for 10 seconds and flushes it constantly. Once you touch the camera, it creates a clip that stars 10 seconds before you touched it, till 10 seconds after. The 20 seconds clip is then automatically uploaded to your phone. Easy as that!
 

 
 
"I wish I had a video of that!"
Most cameras give you only two options: record everything and spend hours editing the raw footage; or worse, miss that special moment because you can’t grab the camera fast enough. Not anymore.
Roader is storing video in a short time memory and does not record anything until you press the camera. When you press it, a video clip is saved that starts 10 seconds back in time. Using the 10-second video that is stored in the short time memory and adding 10 seconds after you pressed the camera.
You can even broadcast your experiences Live using Youtube Live or Facebook Live and keep your phone in your pocket.
