story:
IndieVice Inc. - Discover the Artistic Potential of Your Smartphone

IndieVice is a revolutionary video and photography system that takes the power of your smartphone and evolves it towards a professional handheld camera.

CHECK OUT the DISCOVERY CHANNEL review



The IndieVice is universal smartphone platform that allows you to add lighting, audio, tripods, and includes a bluetooth remote for zoom + Start/Stop recording.
Quickly and easily, slide any smartphone into the IndieVice and begin taking pictures and filming video. Use only one hand and significantly increase stability in seconds. 






                 



          


   What’s a handheld camera without the ability to add your favourite accessories? We thought of that as well. We added three, ¼" - brass threads, two on the top to add your lighting, audio, secondary viewer and a third mount at the bottom to attach a tripod, monopod, slider or even a stabilizer. Depending on your needs, the options are really endless. Bellow are some configuration samples.

 

   A little over 2 years ago we embarked on a journey to create a unique device that would allow us to capture amazing quality videos and photographs with our smartphones, almost under any circumstances.  

   A smartphone or GoPro is a great way for taking video and pictures, but it has its limitations. Glare on the screen, poor audio, limited performance in low light situations, just a few lens options, poor stability and the constant need to use both hands makes it tough to get perfect shots and handle well the camera.  

   So, we set out to create a single device that would maximize the camera potential of the smartphone. We believe we’ve exceeded our expectations.

   Introducing the IndieVice, a completely revolutionary approach to shooting professional videos and photographs with your smartphone or GoPro.

   

   The IndieVice can adapt to any size and shape phone. Our universal smartphone adapter is simple to use, quickly locking your phone in place using only one hand. We can fit all iPhone’s including the 6+, Nokia, Motorola, Samsung, HTC, and Sony.

  The IndieVice is ergonomically designed and also uses Bluetooth technology to allow zoom control with the remote rocker switch. We designed the IndieVice so that you can easily add on virtually any additional equipment. As professional photographers and videographers we built the IndieVice to meet the exacting standards of a typical shoot, but with an ease and simplicity of handling that makes our device accessible to all.



   The IndieVice is a completely new approach to shooting  video and photography with your smartphone.

   Its ergonomic design mimics the natural hold and feel of a professional video camera. Because it is extremely lightweight, it's convenient to carry with you wherever you go and, unlike other smartphone rigs, you can shoot using just one hand.

   The viewfinder adapts to your eyesight through a special dioptric adjustable lens while it's enclosed design eliminates sunlight’s glare on your screen.

  The IndieVice also has a direct screen viewing mode. The 180 degree flip screen provides full accessibility to your smartphone screen functionality for any mobile app adjustments without having to use the viewfinder.

   

    Whether you want quality videos and photos for your personal and family use or are producing professional calibre independent films, journalism or photography, the IndieVice makes it easy.

   Its ergonomic body ensures comfortable shooting, even after hours of use and it also now makes it easier to keep your entire workflow all on one single platform.

   The art of photography depends in large on the type of lenses you use. So with the IndieVice, you can use a large variety of lenses. Our lens adapter can support 52mm and 37mm lenses and single element lenses as well. Our own line of optional lens includes fish eye and ultra-wide angle lenses.

    The IndieVice Pro Model has an adaptable universal lens adapter that allows you to change professional lenses in seconds.


   

Our NEW Static Depth of Field Adapter (DOF) allows you to use your existing SLR equipment with your IndieVice.

   A DOF adapter focuses your image onto a translucent screen located between your external lens and our macro lens. It gives your videos a cinematic look and is worth getting to know, especially since you can use SLR lenses.


   

    Although GoPros are great fixed cameras, they lack a handheld cinematic attachment.  With the indieVice you can now get those handheld cinematic beauty shots which add so much visual value to productions.  


          

    Now you can use your GoPro to make amazing cinematic videos from start to finish using your IndieVice. The GoPro is also compatible with our Bluetooth remote, so you can control start/stop recording functions from the IndieVice.

    One more pro-feature we have added to the IndieVice, is a wireless zoom rocker switch control. You can now control your video and photography app without touching the screen.

   

     The Bluetooth controller is removable and can be magnetically mounted on the IndieVice at several locations. Depending on the holding position, the controller can be placed above or below the top hand-grip. This is ideal for follow-me-shots, below the knee shots, and for popular apps such as Snapchat, Periscope, Skype, etc.. !

   Now you can get those below the knee and above the shoulder shots that were nearly impossible to get before.

   The eyepiece is made of a high quality silicone, which is form fitting and rotates 360° for use with either your left or right eye. You no longer need to try to block the sun’s glare with your hand!

   The IndieVice will make it tough for you to put it down. Be prepared to enter a new world, one where you have complete control. No wifi chip enabled memory stick. No transfers. Just shoot, edit, and post. Make productions faster, easier, and much more professional.

   The IndieVice is ready for manufacturing. Our designs are completed, the global patent pending is in place, and our manufacturers are lined up.  

   We have over 15 years of experience in manufacturing, design, R&D, logistics, and distribution. The IndieVice is not our first product and definitely won't be our last. Our team's extensive experience is just one more reason to feel confident that we are going to make the best IndieVice possible, while making sure it gets delivered to you on time!  

  We need your support IndieGoGo. We have to order expensive molds and require additional capital to buy large quantities in order to receive our volume discounts.

  We want you to have your IndieVice as soon as possible. Here’s our plan to achieve that:

• October: Make lots of new IndieGoGo friends. Execute manufacturing agreement. Finalize the engineering and prototype iterations and place the mold/tooling order.

• October/November: Order all of the molds, review pre-production samples to ensure proper quality, run small batch productions to ensure quality standards are met, review raw material orders 

• November: Continue with pre-production builds. Small run batches for quality assurance and product validation testing on-site. Review prior to final sign off on full production. 

• December: Begin manufacturing, continued batch testing for quality, onsite inspections. Finalize assembly and packaging.

• January/February: Review order fulfillment, review complete order list and final packaging, re-confirm orders with supporters prior to completed shipping manifest.

• March: Received shipment and begin fulfillment. 

   Any pledge amount brings us one step closer to our goal. Help us make the IndieVice product a success by clicking the ‘Back This Project’ button at the top of the page, or help us spread the word by sharing our page with your friends and family.

   We can't wait to see what our products will do in some very capable hands!

The IndieVice Team 

Disclaimer:  

Product names, logos, brands, and other trademarks featured or referred to within IndieVice Inc. products and services and within www.indievice.com  and this IndieGoGo campaign are the property of their respective trademark holders. These trademark holders are not affiliated with IndieVice Inc., our products, or our website. They do not sponsor or endorse our materials.

MANUFACTURING: Creating the tooling to manufacture a product like the IndieVice is expensive and requires expert knowledge to get it right. There is typically a 30-90 day lead time to create the molds for a product of this kind and this is where delays could occur. To minimize that possibility, we're working with tooling manufacturing partners with a track record for outstanding quality and turnaround time.

PRODUCT ADJUSTMENTS: We really think that all the kinks have been worked out. But you just never know until you go into production. If changes need to be made, you can be assured that our only objective will be making the best IndieVice product possible. We're counting on you the consumer to make the IndieVice a huge success and we will let you know exactly how and why any changes are made.  

FULFILLMENT: To minimize the possibility of manufacturing setbacks we will enter the manufacturing stage with two back-up suppliers for each component. We ourselves will be handling all of the shipments to our plant in North America, expediting what is necessary to make sure we hit target deadlines. Once at our plant, we will coordinate the shipping and fulfilment with a hands-on approach.

Why You Can Count On Us?

Our team has over 25 years of experience in professional videography and photography. For the past 10 years we have focused on design and innovation in these fields. We also have over 15 years of manufacturing, design and R&D. And, you can be assured that we have our supply chain and logistics/shipping covered.

To manufacture the IndieVice we will be partnering with a major manufacturer who has a lengthy track record of delivering high quality consumer products. We will work with them at every stage, from manufacturing to distribution. This will ensure that you not only get your IndieVice on time, but that it meets the exacting standards of our design. 

By backing our IndieGoGo campaign you can be one of the first in the world with an IndieVice, and at a reduced price. You'll be contributing to a truly revolutionary technology that transforms the power of your smartphone into a personal production house.

Your pledge will help bring this cool idea one step closer to our goal. Help us make the IndieVice a great success by clicking the "Back This Project" button at the top of the page, and help us spread the word by clicking on the "Share this project" button.

Thanks for taking the time to find out more about us. We hope you become part of our journey and an extra special thank-you for your support if you do. 

The IndieVice Team

completely revolutionary approach to shooting professional videos and
photographs with your smartphone or GoPro.


        

                
   

   The IndieVice can adapt
to any size and shape phone. Our universal smartphone adapter is simple to use,
quickly locking your phone in place using only one hand. We can fit all iPhone’s
including the 6+, Nokia, Motorola, Samsung, HTC, and Sony.

   
 
The IndieVice is
ergonomically designed and also uses Bluetooth technology to allow zoom control
with the remote rocker switch. We designed the IndieVice so that you can easily
add on virtually any additional equipment. As professional photographers and
videographers we built the IndieVice to meet the exacting standards of a
typical shoot, but with an ease and simplicity of handling that makes our
device accessible to all.



       




                   

   The IndieVice is a completely new
approach to shooting  video and photography with your smartphone.
   Its ergonomic design mimics the
natural hold and feel of a professional video camera. Because it is extremely
lightweight, it's convenient to carry with you wherever you go and, unlike
other smartphone rigs, you can shoot using just one hand.





                  


   The
viewfinder adapts to your eyesight through a special dioptric adjustable lens
while it's enclosed design eliminates sunlight’s glare on your screen.

  




            
 
The IndieVice also has a
direct screen viewing mode. The 180 degree flip screen provides full
accessibility to your smartphone screen functionality for any mobile app
adjustments without having to use the viewfinder.

     *** The Video APP shown in the above animation is FiLMiC Pro. Our Favorite APP.

                       
   
    Whether you want quality videos and photos for
your personal and family use or are producing professional calibre independent
films, journalism or photography, the IndieVice makes it easy.
   Its ergonomic body ensures
comfortable shooting, even after hours of use and it also now makes it easier
to keep your entire workflow all on one single platform.


          




          

   
   The art of photography depends in
large on the type of lenses you use. So with the IndieVice, you can use a large
variety of lenses. Our lens adapter can support 52mm and 37mm lenses and single
element lenses as well. Our own line of optional lens includes fish eye and
ultra-wide angle lenses.
    The IndieVice Pro Model has an
adaptable universal lens adapter that allows you to change professional lenses
in seconds.



     

                                                               


   
Our NEW Static Depth of Field Adapter (DOF)
allows you to use your existing SLR equipment with your IndieVice.
   A DOF adapter focuses your image
onto a translucent screen located between your external lens and our macro
lens. It gives your videos a cinematic look and is worth getting to know,
especially since you can use SLR lenses.



                   
    

    Although
GoPros are great fixed cameras, they lack a handheld cinematic attachment.
 With the indieVice you can now get those handheld cinematic beauty shots
which add so much visual value to productions.  

          

    Now you can use your GoPro to make amazing cinematic videos from start to finish using your IndieVice. The GoPro is also compatible with our Bluetooth remote, so you can control start/stop recording functions from the IndieVice.

      


                    


    One more pro-feature we
have added to the IndieVice, is a wireless zoom rocker switch control. You can
now control your video and photography app without touching the screen.

        
   
     The Bluetooth controller is removable and can
be magnetically mounted on the IndieVice at several locations. Depending on the
holding position, the controller can be placed above or below the top
hand-grip. This is ideal for follow-me-shots, below the knee shots, and for
popular apps such as Snapchat, Periscope, Skype, etc.. !
   Now you can get those below the
knee and above the shoulder shots that were nearly impossible to get before.


     

                Discover the Artistic Potential of your Smartphone with the IndieVice

                      
   The eyepiece is made of a high quality silicone, which is form fitting and rotates 360° for use with either your left or right eye. You no longer need to try to block the sun’s glare with your hand!

         
   The IndieVice will make it tough for you to put it down. Be prepared to enter a new world, one where you have complete control. No wifi chip enabled memory stick. No transfers. Just shoot, edit, and post. Make productions faster, easier, and much more professional.

                               Add a Secondary Viewfinder for Below the Knee Shots

        

         SPECIAL THANKSWe wanted to thank FiLMiC Pro for allowing us to use their amazing APP in our animation. If you have not downloaded it yet, make sure to do so today. You can learn more about the feature platform that FiLMiC Pro offers at www.filmicpro.com. 

                    
   The IndieVice is ready for manufacturing. Our designs are completed, the global patent pending is in place, and our manufacturers are lined up.  
   We have over 15 years of experience in manufacturing, design, R&D, logistics, and distribution. The IndieVice is not our first product and definitely won't be our last. Our team's extensive experience is just one more reason to feel confident that we are going to make the best IndieVice possible, while making sure it gets delivered to you on time!  
  We need your support IndieGoGo. We have to order expensive molds and require additional capital to buy large quantities in order to receive our volume discounts.
  We want you to have your IndieVice as soon as possible. Here’s our plan to achieve that:
• October: Make lots of new IndieGoGo friends. Execute manufacturing agreement. Finalize the engineering and prototype iterations and place the mold/tooling order.
• October/November: Order all of the molds, review pre-production samples to ensure proper quality, run small batch productions to ensure quality standards are met, review raw material orders 
• November: Continue with pre-production builds. Small run batches for quality assurance and product validation testing on-site. Review prior to final sign off on full production. 
• December: Begin manufacturing, continued batch testing for quality, onsite inspections. Finalize assembly and packaging.
• January/February: Review order fulfillment, review complete order list and final packaging, re-confirm orders with supporters prior to completed shipping manifest.
• March: Received shipment and begin fulfillment. 
   Any pledge amount brings us one step closer to our goal. Help us make the IndieVice product a success by clicking the ‘Back This Project’ button at the top of the page, or help us spread the word by sharing our page with your friends and family.
   We can't wait to see what our products will do in some very capable hands!
The IndieVice Team 

The IndieVice - Pro Model
Disclaimer:  
Product names, logos, brands, and other trademarks featured or referred to within IndieVice Inc. products and services and within www.indievice.com  and this IndieGoGo campaign are the property of their respective trademark holders. These trademark holders are not affiliated with IndieVice Inc., our products, or our website. They do not sponsor or endorse our materials.

                  


MANUFACTURING: Creating the tooling to manufacture a product like the IndieVice is expensive and requires expert knowledge to get it right. There is typically a 30-90 day lead time to create the molds for a product of this kind and this is where delays could occur. To minimize that possibility, we're working with tooling manufacturing partners with a track record for outstanding quality and turnaround time.
PRODUCT ADJUSTMENTS: We really think that all the kinks have been worked out. But you just never know until you go into production. If changes need to be made, you can be assured that our only objective will be making the best IndieVice product possible. We're counting on you the consumer to make the IndieVice a huge success and we will let you know exactly how and why any changes are made.  
FULFILLMENT: To minimize the possibility of manufacturing setbacks we will enter the manufacturing stage with two back-up suppliers for each component. We ourselves will be handling all of the shipments to our plant in North America, expediting what is necessary to make sure we hit target deadlines. Once at our plant, we will coordinate the shipping and fulfilment with a hands-on approach.
Why You Can Count On Us?
Our team has over 25 years of experience in professional videography and photography. For the past 10 years we have focused on design and innovation in these fields. We also have over 15 years of manufacturing, design and R&D. And, you can be assured that we have our supply chain and logistics/shipping covered.
To manufacture the IndieVice we will be partnering with a major manufacturer who has a lengthy track record of delivering high quality consumer products. We will work with them at every stage, from manufacturing to distribution. This will ensure that you not only get your IndieVice on time, but that it meets the exacting standards of our design. 
By backing our IndieGoGo campaign you can be one of the first in the world with an IndieVice, and at a reduced price. You'll be contributing to a truly revolutionary technology that transforms the power of your smartphone into a personal production house.
Your pledge will help bring this cool idea one step closer to our goal. Help us make the IndieVice a great success by clicking the "Back This Project" button at the top of the page, and help us spread the word by clicking on the "Share this project" button.
Thanks for taking the time to find out more about us. We hope you become part of our journey and an extra special thank-you for your support if you do. 
The IndieVice Team

story:
Hello everyone coming through here.

My name is Gladys. My photography name is Mari-Eli Photography. Where did I get the name you ask. Well, its after my only daughter out of four children. She inspires me everyday.

I've been shooting for about 10 years. Different kinds of photography. I started off with cars, then added pinup models and later bought some real cheap lights and did indoor photography. I loved it so much that I started taking classes in photography at my local college. I had to stop for a while due to some very drastic changes in my life. I put the camera away for about two years. Then my oldest son wanted to have me teach him about the camera and all of what I know.  That made me pick that camera up again. But now that I see my equipment, I notice that its time to upgrade my bag of tricks.

I hope that I can depend on friends and family to help me raise funds to upgrade what I have. I'll be starting school in August again and I want to be ready for all assignments thrown at me. Please help me out. This also will help me advance in my skills so I can provide more for my family. My goal is also to create the best work I can and offer. I know the struggle is real for many of us but a small contribution goes a long way. I hope I can count on you.

Thanks you so much for taking the time to read a little bit about my campaign.

Gladys Vee

story:
About us

Astronomical group Sarajevo was founded on May 9, 2014. Currently, the group has over 800 members and continuously promotes astronomy. In the past three years, a lot of projects have been done, and these are some of them:

  1. Detection of asteroids and estimation of their orbital parameters
  2. Photometry of variable stars
  3. Astrophotography (planets, Moon, Sun, comets, deep sky objects: galaxies, nebulae and star clusters)
  4. Writing educational texts from astronomy, astrophotography, and photometry
  5. Different “Do It Yourself” projects (custom astro-tracker construction, camera modification (removal of IR filter), binocular stabilization, mount modification, solargraphy etc)
  6. Open access Astro parties for community
  7. Facebook page and Facebook group with over 800 members
  8. Promoting astronomy in media
  9. Establishing contact with schools, scientific institutions, other astronomical societies and astrophotographers around the world

For more information about our work (Bosnian language): https://alancatovic.files.wordpress.com/2017/01...

Campaign goal

The campaign aims to raise funds for the purchase of a new CCD camera. Namely, we have reached a maximum with our current camera (DSLR)  and in order to do more, better equipment is needed, above all a more sensitive camera for astronomy.

With the new CCD camera, the following projects are planned:

  • Detection of new asteroids and comets
  • Detection of extrasolar planets
  • Photometry of stars
  • Spectroscopy of stars
  • Narrowband Astrophotography

The mentioned projects will contribute to further development of astronomy that has been ravaged in our country since the war from 1995.

Required equipment and costs

To meet these goals, the following equipment is required:

  1. ATIK383L+ 8 Megapixel b/w CCD camera – cooled – low noise – Sensor: Kodak KAF 8300 17.6 x 13.52mm (https://www.teleskop-express.de/shop/product_in...)
  2. Baader Filter Set LRGBC + Narrowband H-alpha/O-III/S-II, 2 inch thread (http://www.teleskop-express.de/shop/product_inf...)
  3. ATIK 2″ motorized filter wheel – USB connection – for 5x 2″ filter (http://www.teleskop-express.de/shop/product_inf...)
  4. Astronomik ASCLSCCD2 – CLS CCD Filter, 2 inch mounted (http://www.teleskop-express.de/shop/product_inf...)
  5. Star Analyser 100 (http://www.teleskop-express.de/shop/product_inf...)
  6. Adapters (http://www.teleskop-express.de/shop/product_inf...  i  http://www.teleskop-express.de/shop/product_inf...)

Total costs of equipment (including VAT, Customs costs, and Indigogo provision): 4720 $ (4140 EUR)

More info can be found at (bosnian and english version): https://alancatovic.wordpress.com/2017/07/10/cr...

For more information or further questions, please contact acatovic@gmail.com or jasarevic.dzan@gmail.com

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

(Bosnian language version)

O nama

Neformalna astronomska grupa Sarajevo nastala je 9. maja 2014. godine. Trenutno grupa broji preko 800 članova i kontinuirano promoviše astronomiju. U protekle tri godine urađeno je dosta projekata, a ovo su neki od njih:

  1. Detekcija asteroida i procjena njihovih orbitalnih parametara
  2. Fotometrija varijabilnih zvijezda
  3. Astrofotografija (planete, Mjesec, Sunce, komete, udaljeni nebeski objekti: galaksije, magline i zvjezdani skupovi)
  4. Pisanje tekstova iz opšte astronomije, astrofotografije i fotometrije
  5. Različiti “Do It Yourself” projekti (konstrukcija astro-trackera, modifikacija kamere, stabilizacija dvogleda, modifikacija postolja, solargrafija itd)
  6. Održavanje „Astro partija“ (posmatranje noćnog neba) za širu javnost
  7. Facebook stranica i Facebook grupa sa preko 800 članova
  8. Promovisanje astronomije u medijima
  9. Upostavljanje kontakta sa školama, naučnim institucijama, drugim astronomskim društvima i astrofotografima širom svijeta

Više informacija o našem radu: https://alancatovic.files.wordpress.com/2017/01...

Cilj kampanje

Cilj kampanje je prikupljanje finansijskih sredstava za kupovinu nove CCD kamere. Naime, iz opreme koju trenutno imamo izvučen je maksimum i da bi se uradile ozbiljnije stvari, potrebna je bolja oprema, prije svega osjetljivija kamera za astronomiju.
Sa novom CCD kamerom planiraju se slijedeći projekti:

  • Detekcija novih asteroida i kometa
  • Detekcija ekstrasolarnih planeta (planeta oko drugih zvijezda)
  • Fotometrija zvijezda
  • Spektroskopija zvijezda
  • „Narrowband“ astrofotografija

Spomenuti projekti predstavljaju značajan naučni iskorak u BiH i doprinijet će razvoju astronomije koja je u našoj zemlji na koljenima još od završetka rata 1995. godine.

Potrebna oprema i troškovi

Za ispunjenje navedenih ciljeva potrebna je slijedeća oprema:

  1. ATIK383L+ 8 Megapixel b/w CCD camera - cooled - low noise - Sensor: Kodak KAF 8300 17.6 x 13.52mm (https://www.teleskop-express.de/shop/product_in...)
  2. Baader Filter Set LRGBC + Narrowband H-alpha/O-III/S-II, 2 inch thread (http://www.teleskop-express.de/shop/product_inf...)
  3. ATIK 2" motorized filter wheel - USB connection - for 5x 2" filter (http://www.teleskop-express.de/shop/product_inf...)
  4. Astronomik ASCLSCCD2 - CLS CCD Filter, 2 inch mounted (http://www.teleskop-express.de/shop/product_inf...)
  5. Star Analyser 100 (http://www.teleskop-express.de/shop/product_inf...)
  6. Adapteri (http://www.teleskop-express.de/shop/product_inf...  i  http://www.teleskop-express.de/shop/product_inf...)

Ukupni troškovi (oprema, PDV, carina, Indigogo servis): 4720 $ (4140 EUR)

Za više informacija ili pitanja, javite se na acatovic@gmail.com ili jasarevic.dzan@gmail.com.

story:
Content creators, we built this for you.

Alice is an AI camera that works with your smartphone to shoot and share better content in a fraction of the time. Capture crystal clear 4K footage straight out of camera — and share it instantly to your followers.

The experience of a phone, the capability of a high-end mirrorless camera. This is the camera for creators.

Credit: Naomi Christie

 

Alice is an AI-accelerated computational camera. It's a compact and low-profile camera which can be mounted onto the back of your smartphone.

Fast wireless data transfer between camera and phone gives you a seamless real-time viewfinder on your smartphone.

 Read this blog post to see how Alice got its name. 

The phone-grip mechanism works with smartphones as small as the iPhone 6 width (6.42 cm / 2.53 inch) until as large as the iPhone 12 Pro Max width (7.81 cm / 3.07 inch).

Alice will work with both iOS and Android phones, including Samsung, Google, One Plus or any other phone with similar dimensions.

Credit: Naomi Christie

The Alice Camera native smartphone app will connect to and control Alice with a touchscreen interface, giving you a smooth user experience and a faster production workflow.

Create faster with an intuitive experience designed by creators for creators. Get the edge on other creators with a camera that lets you instantly stream and post in 4K, wherever you are. No need to stop to download, export or render.

Instantly live stream and post to Twitch, Youtube, TikTok, Instagram and Facebook with a push of a button. Delighting your audience is as simple as: point, shoot, share.

Credit: Naomi Christie

Flip your phone around to work in selfie mode too!

Stand out from the crowd with a 4/3 sensor eight times bigger than your phone’s.  The sensor is similar to the ones found in professional cameras such as the Panasonic GH5S and Black Magic Pocket.

Attach pro lenses and wow your audience with high-quality video captured in full-width 4K.

The imaging sensor inside of Alice has dual native ISO and a quad-bayer structure giving you excellent low-light performance, high dynamic range, exceptionally low noise. 

Edited sample image taken by the Alice Camera indoors and with no flash

Make Alice work for you by attaching any Micro Four Thirds lens, the most flexible and compact interchangeable lens system around, with over 50 professional-quality lenses available. Alice will support autofocus, aperture adjustment and lens stabilisation on all standards-compliant MFT lenses. An ergonomic handle enables better hand placement and stability whilst capturing your scenes.

Attach an adapter to use lenses with different mounts too! There are several lens mount adapters in the market which allow Canon and Nikon lenses as well as a range of vintage lenses to be used with the Micro Four Thirds mount. This video is an extremely helpful explainer:

Harness computational photography to capture the perfect shot straight out of camera. Expand your creativity with AI autofocus, colour science, image enhancement and open source access.

Alice maximises raw capture detail and automatically controls the optical system to give you the best photos and videos straight out of the camera. You set up the shot, leave the rest to Alice.

Take your content to the next level with a shoot-and-share camera that performs trillions of calculations every single second using Google'e edge TPU.

Our patent pending technology allows you to automatically adjust and improve focusing, exposure, colour, night-time shots, object tracking, stabilisation, scene recognition - everything to give you the best shot straight out of camera, so you can focus on composition. 

Read our blog post Computational Photography, Artificial Intelligence and Alice to learn about our four rules of computational photography,

Automation
Alice uses cutting-edge end-to-end deep learning techniques to automate focus, exposure and colour balance. Our algorithms are trained on a huge number of images and use artificial intelligence to learn to adjust focus, exposure and colour correction quickly and accurately in real time.

Image Enhancement
Alice’s advanced AI and multi-shot based image enhancement techniques improve dynamic range and low-light performance giving you professional-quality post-processed shots straight out of the camera in real time. The algorithms are conservative by default and designed to give you more control over your creative process.



Electronic Stabilisation
Alice uses an on-board gyroscope and some clever processing for electronic stabilisation, giving you silky smooth videos free from hand shake. You get full control over the strength of the effect and the amount of cropping used.

Object tracking and scene recognition
The AI inside Alice has contextual understanding and awareness allowing it to track a variety of objects. Over time, Alice will learn to track more and more objects.

Our smartphone app will have two modes, both designed for creators.

Quick Mode will apply all of our AI settings in auto, allowing you to capture the moment in an instant. Pro Mode will allow you to manually override the settings and will give you maximum control over the final shot.

The camera system and firmware will improve with future software updates through our app.

Menu systems on mirrorless cameras and DSLRs are convoluted, complicated and hard to navigate - you'll probably end up missing the sunset before you can change the white balance. 

With Alice, you’ll get full control over the final shot in time to capture even the most fleeting of moments.

Never miss a shot
Menu controls with Alice are simple and easy to use. Fine tune with our intuitive pro settings so you can control your shots like never before — fast.

Imagine a menu system that’s easy to use and navigate, that gives you time instead of taking it? That’s Alice. Organise and search through your photos easily with your smartphone's touch screen.

You want every image and video to be better than the last. So do we. Regular updates mean your camera will always stay up-to-date with the latest tech and features.

Plus, Alice’s open-source software can be customised like no other camera — anyone will be free to build add-ons and features, and everyone will be able to benefit. 

Alice will work on both iOS and Android phones.

 

Get started with Alice in six easy steps!

Alice Explorer Perk (Maximum 6 spots available)

The ultimate travel adventure. A long-awaited travel trip with your Alice Camera around the best parts of Europe. No hassle, we will organise everything!

Locations include:

  1. London, UK
  2. Paris, France
  3. Berlin, Germany
  4. Warsaw, Poland
  5. Prague, Czech Republic
  6. Budapest, Hungary
  7. Rome, Italy
  8. Amalfi Coast, Italy
  9. Barcelona, Spain
  10. Lisbon, Portugal

By becoming an Explorer, you will receive a fully organised trip around Europe and exclusive access to our team to help shape future features of Alice. Full details can be found here.

 

Do you have old gear that you never use anymore sitting around at home? Consider selling some of your old equipment on MPB, Wex, B&H and KEH Camera to reinvest in Alice.

Refer Friends & Get Cash Back! 

With our referral program powered by Kickbooster, when you can refer friends to pre-order on Indiegogo you can earn 7% Cash Back on each friend referred. Sign up now!

Our mission is to empower the next generation of creators.

Our team is made up of creators, photographers and engineers and we set out to build Alice because we were frustrated by the lack of innovation and usability of the digital cameras in the market today. 

Our development has been turbocharged by taking part in several prestigious accelerator programmes run by Entrepreneur First, UCL Innovation & Enterprise, NVIDIA and the Digital Catapult.

We won a £175,000 grant from Innovate UK, the UK Government's innovation agency, which means we have the funds necessary to continue the development of the Alice Camera.

We joined the Micro Four Thirds System standard run by Olympus and Panasonic which means that Alice will be fully compliant with the requirements of the standard.

We've been working together with Aetha Design over the last 12 months to refine, test and perfect the design of Alice. 

Aetha Design was founded by engineers from Dyson and have vast experience designing consumer electronics, camera products and lifestyle products.

The Aetha team started out with initial sketches and concept drawings of the Alice Camera and then produced a series of CAD designs and 3D printed models to test the aesthetics, ergonomics and core hardware features.

The Aetha team then produced the first prototype of the Alice Camera made entirely from CNC'd aluminium and we've been refining the prototype ever since in terms with our group of 30 beta customers.

We're working with our partners SMS Electronics to manufacture the Alice Camera in Britain, ensuring our supply chain is local, efficient and sustainable.  SMS will streamline our supply chain, reduce risk and costs, test the electronics and will accelerate our delivery for you.

SMS Electronics have been in the electronics manufacturing industry for 100 years and are one of the largest electronic manufacturers in Europe.

Below are the specifications of Alice:

Note: Please be aware that shipping and taxes are not included in the pledge levels.

All shipping fees will be collected separately once the campaign is over. Please see below for estimates:

Shipping estimates for 1 Alice Camera (body only):  United States: £30 | United Kingdom: £5 | EU: £30 | Rest of the World: £30

VAT/Customs duty will be calculated for customers (excluding the UK) once the campaign is over and the responsibility is at the time of delivery for the backer. Taxes will vary based on where your rewards are shipped (Sorry, we don’t make the rules).

Artificial intelligence and computational photography has the potential to fundamentally change the photographic industry and art form to the same extent when digital replaced film 20 years ago. We want to harness AI to drive this change and we hope you will join us on our journey.

Credit: Naomi Christie
story_txt:
Content creators, we built this for you.
Alice is an AI camera that works with your smartphone to shoot and share better content in a fraction of the time. Capture crystal clear 4K footage straight out of camera — and share it instantly to your followers.
The experience of a phone, the capability of a high-end mirrorless camera. This is the camera for creators.
 Credit: Naomi Christie
 
Alice is an AI-accelerated computational camera. It's a compact and low-profile camera which can be mounted onto the back of your smartphone.
Fast wireless data transfer between camera and phone gives you a seamless real-time viewfinder on your smartphone.
 Read this blog post to see how Alice got its name. 



The phone-grip mechanism works with smartphones as small as the iPhone 6 width (6.42 cm / 2.53 inch) until as large as the iPhone 12 Pro Max width (7.81 cm / 3.07 inch).
Alice will work with both iOS and Android phones, including Samsung, Google, One Plus or any other phone with similar dimensions.

 Credit: Naomi Christie


The Alice Camera native smartphone app will connect to and control Alice with a touchscreen interface, giving you a smooth user experience and a faster production workflow.

Create faster with an intuitive experience designed by creators for creators. Get the edge on other creators with a camera that lets you instantly stream and post in 4K, wherever you are. No need to stop to download, export or render.

Instantly live stream and post to Twitch, Youtube, TikTok, Instagram and Facebook with a push of a button. Delighting your audience is as simple as: point, shoot, share.

Credit: Naomi Christie
Flip your phone around to work in selfie mode too!

Stand out from the crowd with a 4/3 sensor eight times bigger than your phone’s.  The sensor is similar to the ones found in professional cameras such as the Panasonic GH5S and Black Magic Pocket.
Attach pro lenses and wow your audience with high-quality video captured in full-width 4K.

The imaging sensor inside of Alice has dual native ISO and a quad-bayer structure giving you excellent low-light performance, high dynamic range, exceptionally low noise. 
Edited sample image taken by the Alice Camera indoors and with no flash
Make Alice work for you by attaching any Micro Four Thirds lens, the most flexible and compact interchangeable lens system around, with over 50 professional-quality lenses available. Alice will support autofocus, aperture adjustment and lens stabilisation on all standards-compliant MFT lenses. An ergonomic handle enables better hand placement and stability whilst capturing your scenes.

Attach an adapter to use lenses with different mounts too! There are several lens mount adapters in the market which allow Canon and Nikon lenses as well as a range of vintage lenses to be used with the Micro Four Thirds mount. This video is an extremely helpful explainer:

Harness computational photography to capture the perfect shot straight out of camera. Expand your creativity with AI autofocus, colour science, image enhancement and open source access.
Alice maximises raw capture detail and automatically controls the optical system to give you the best photos and videos straight out of the camera. You set up the shot, leave the rest to Alice.

Take your content to the next level with a shoot-and-share camera that performs trillions of calculations every single second using Google'e edge TPU.

Our patent pending technology allows you to automatically adjust and improve focusing, exposure, colour, night-time shots, object tracking, stabilisation, scene recognition - everything to give you the best shot straight out of camera, so you can focus on composition. 
Read our blog post Computational Photography, Artificial Intelligence and Alice to learn about our four rules of computational photography,

AutomationAlice uses cutting-edge end-to-end deep learning techniques to automate focus, exposure and colour balance. Our algorithms are trained on a huge number of images and use artificial intelligence to learn to adjust focus, exposure and colour correction quickly and accurately in real time.
Image EnhancementAlice’s advanced AI and multi-shot based image enhancement techniques improve dynamic range and low-light performance giving you professional-quality post-processed shots straight out of the camera in real time. The algorithms are conservative by default and designed to give you more control over your creative process.

Electronic StabilisationAlice uses an on-board gyroscope and some clever processing for electronic stabilisation, giving you silky smooth videos free from hand shake. You get full control over the strength of the effect and the amount of cropping used.

Object tracking and scene recognitionThe AI inside Alice has contextual understanding and awareness allowing it to track a variety of objects. Over time, Alice will learn to track more and more objects.



Our smartphone app will have two modes, both designed for creators.
Quick Mode will apply all of our AI settings in auto, allowing you to capture the moment in an instant. Pro Mode will allow you to manually override the settings and will give you maximum control over the final shot.
The camera system and firmware will improve with future software updates through our app.

Menu systems on mirrorless cameras and DSLRs are convoluted, complicated and hard to navigate - you'll probably end up missing the sunset before you can change the white balance. 
With Alice, you’ll get full control over the final shot in time to capture even the most fleeting of moments.
Never miss a shotMenu controls with Alice are simple and easy to use. Fine tune with our intuitive pro settings so you can control your shots like never before — fast.

Imagine a menu system that’s easy to use and navigate, that gives you time instead of taking it? That’s Alice. Organise and search through your photos easily with your smartphone's touch screen.


You want every image and video to be better than the last. So do we. Regular updates mean your camera will always stay up-to-date with the latest tech and features.
Plus, Alice’s open-source software can be customised like no other camera — anyone will be free to build add-ons and features, and everyone will be able to benefit. 
Alice will work on both iOS and Android phones.



 


Get started with Alice in six easy steps!






Alice Explorer Perk (Maximum 6 spots available)
The ultimate travel adventure. A long-awaited travel trip with your Alice Camera around the best parts of Europe. No hassle, we will organise everything!
Locations include:

London, UK
Paris, France
Berlin, Germany
Warsaw, Poland
Prague, Czech Republic
Budapest, Hungary
Rome, Italy
Amalfi Coast, Italy
Barcelona, Spain
Lisbon, Portugal

By becoming an Explorer, you will receive a fully organised trip around Europe and exclusive access to our team to help shape future features of Alice. Full details can be found here.

 
Do you have old gear that you never use anymore sitting around at home? Consider selling some of your old equipment on MPB, Wex, B&H and KEH Camera to reinvest in Alice.

Our mission is to empower the next generation of creators.

Aetha Design was founded by engineers from Dyson and have vast experience designing consumer electronics, camera products and lifestyle products.

The Aetha team started out with initial sketches and concept drawings of the Alice Camera and then produced a series of CAD designs and 3D printed models to test the aesthetics, ergonomics and core hardware features.

The Aetha team then produced the first prototype of the Alice Camera made entirely from CNC'd aluminium and we've been refining the prototype ever since in terms with our group of 30 beta customers.


We're working with our partners SMS Electronics to manufacture the Alice Camera in Britain, ensuring our supply chain is local, efficient and sustainable.  SMS will streamline our supply chain, reduce risk and costs, test the electronics and will accelerate our delivery for you.
SMS Electronics have been in the electronics manufacturing industry for 100 years and are one of the largest electronic manufacturers in Europe.
