Among them, 36% would need 7 days or more to get a replacement, and 27% would never get any form of compensation for these stolen packages, valued at around $160 on average. As the courier approaches, they will be alerted to the presence of SmartDrop via voice guide and the illuminated buttons. The clear and easy-to-follow instructions allow the courier to complete the delivery in just seconds.We performed an experiment in our home area of Seattle, WA, and found that with a sample size of 100 delivery persons, 92% of them were eager to use SmartDrop, with a 93.5% success rate, proving that SmartDrop is a welcome addition for both homeowners and delivery persons. We noticed that some of you had concerns over how easy SmartDrop is to use for couriers. We put together this little video to help ease any concerns.When SmartDrop is empty, all the courier needs to do is tap the OPEN button and place the package inside.When a package is held within SmartDrop, the device will be locked to keep it safe. Should you receive another delivery, the courier simply needs to enter the access code on the waybill to unlock it.To generate a Courier Code:Step 1: Generate a Courier Code on the app, which you can change as frequently as you want.Step 2: Include the code as part of your shipping address when you place your order online, for example: "8000 Main St., Apt 10010 (Delivery Box Code: 1234)".SmartDrop is designed with flexibility in mind, offering a choice of access methods:Default Mode: Tap to open when it’s empty, PIN code/App/Voice Assistants/Physical key to open when it’s not 
Locked Mode: Always requiring PIN code/App/Voice Assistants/Physical key to open, empty or not
Unlocked Mode: Always tap to open, whether SmartDrop is empty or not
Deliveries Denied Mode: The only way to open it is to use the MasterPIN or physical key
The 1080p full HD camera captures the movement of people as they approach your porch. With motion-triggered recording (available with HomeBase 1 & 2 or Cloud Storage), eufy Security SmartDrop can even double up as your front door security camera. Powerful night vision is capable of providing clear black and white video at night. When a delivery is completed you will receive an instant notification via the app. You can check the full event by watching the recorded video (available with HomeBase 1 & 2 or Cloud Storage) from start to finish, giving you peace of mind that your delivery is safe. If the courier encounters any issues, simply jump to the live-stream, and talk to them via the 2-way audio to ensure your package can be delivered smoothly.  Simply use Alexa or the Google Assistant to conveniently check on the status of your SmartDrop.  SmartDrop is designed to be water-resistant. The exterior is designed with a sophisticated water diversion system, which diverts the rainwater infiltrated from the outside to the bottom drainage trough through the surrounding inner wall to protect packages from getting wet.  Complete the full DIY assembly of SmartDrop in only 20 minutes. When you place it on your porch, bolt the device down to the ground or to the wall using expansion screws. When paired with HomeBase 1 or 2 you will get 16GB of local storage space with military-grade encryption. If you wish for more storage space, you could purchase additional Cloud Storage to reach unlimited capacity for 30 days.  SmartDrop Pro comes with a HomeBase 2, which enables video recording and 16Gb of local storage.   Born out of Kickstarter 3 years ago with eufyCam -- a product that took the world by storm, eufy Security has since developed into a complete ecosystem, while keeping our pioneering spirit, offering cutting edge features at attractive prices. This time again we’re working with Anker to bring SmartDrop to life to provide the most intelligent solution on the market for securing your valuable home deliveries. With your support, we’ll continue to offer innovative, smart home security solutions to protect you, your family, and your privacy.  Risks and challengesAn on-time delivery date for SmartDrop is anticipated. We’re wrapping up the product development phase for the main features, but we’d still like to hear great ideas to implement from you, our backers, about features we can include (as long as it doesn’t impact the delivery date). We’ve found reliable manufacturing partners, but even with the best manufacturing processes setup, unexpected hiccups can happen. Logistics issues are also being solved to ensure smooth delivery for when we’ve exceeded our goal.

story:
The magic of View-Master

Do you remember View-Master? You know, those viewers with the round paper reels that traveled you all over the world through their tiny little 3D slide pictures.....

 Did you, or do you yet have one?

View-Master* has been around for more than 75 years, exciting children and adults with its "come to life" 3D pictures.

It was introduced back in 1939 as a means of showing scenic 3D photographs and since then, thousands of places have been depicted on its reels.

In the course of time, more and variable themes were added to its library (fairy tales, movies, educational etc) and a group of dedicated fans and collectors developed around the world.

Now, new,  improved viewers and reels are being manufactured under the strictest standards of quality in new facilities and with modern equipment (we are talking about the original View-Master, not some kind of replica). 

 

About us

We are independent producers and, in coordination with the company that currently manufactures the View-Master*, we aim to produce a series of new 3 reel packets (scenic and others), in an effort to keep alive the View-Master tradition worldwide.

On that, we have gathered together a group of skilled 3D photographers and other artists who share our passion about this beloved "toy".

*View-Master is a trandmark of Fisher-Price/Mattel and everything we do is/or will be under licence and approval of them.

 

About this packet

This 3reel packet is about the UNESCO World Heritage Site of Delphi, the imposing archaelogical site of the famous oracle of antiquity in Greece.

It will be part of a series of packets we plan to produce, about the most prominent UNESCO World Heritage sites and monuments of the world.

Initialy produced for the Greek Organization that operated the museum gift shop -until it ceased its operation- this packet depicts in 21 glorious 3D photographs, the main monuments of the site and the museum.

After a lot of adventures and changes in production process (we should write a book sometime about this:), we are back and ask you to help us accomplish this project.  

              

 

What We Need

This is one of the most expencive scenic packets to produce.

Here's a cost calculation:

$52,500 production cost for 10,000 pcs (including rights fees and taxes)

$28,200 shipping cost of the perks to contributors

$6,000 cost of the prize (a trip to Greece) for our refferal contest winner 

$8,700 indiegogo and transaction fees charges

This is an all or nothing campaign for the production of 10,000 3reel packets.

They may, or may not be re-issued in the future, so, this is the chance for you to obtain a piece of culture (on location they'll be sold at least $15,00).

 

What You Get

And here's the perks:

1. For $1, $2 or $3 pledging you help us reach our goal and you can participate in our referral contest with great prizes for the winners!!!

Share the campaign with your friends (using indiegogo's tools), ask them to join and pledge. Even a $1 can make the difference!!

2. For $5,00 pledging, you get a commemorative thanking postcard, mailed to you directly from Delphi's post office, plus the fact that you can be the winner of our contest by bringing in the most pledges to our campaign. 

3. For $10,00 pledging you get one Delphi 3reel packet, shipped to your address, plus of course the chance to win the trip to Greece, by winning our contest!  

4. This is for companies: for $6,000 you'll have your advertisement/logo placed permanently on the rare side of the reels!! In contrast of other printing matterials,View-Master reels are made to last, and your message will be around for decades!! Also, your company's logo will feature prominently on our campaign page, as the official sponsor of the project. Just, before pledging for this, please contact us to see if your object is suitable for the View-Master.

         

 

Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    Spread the word by using the Indiegogo share tools. There may be many friends of yours that would be excited to help and will thank you for this!

    If you are a company or organization and would like to attach your name with our project, you can be designated an "official supporter" and have your name/firm displayed in our newsfeed as such, by sharing our project through your email lists, site, social media pages etc.

    We are planning more themes to come, both scenic and story telling, so, keep in touch!

     

    Our referral contest

    Spread the word about our campaign, reffer to as many of your friends and contacts as you can by sharing it using Indiegogo's sharing tools, and you may be the winner of a trip to Greece for two and other interesting prizes.*

     

    1) If you bring to our campaign at least $500.00 in contributions through your referrals, we'll give you the option to buy as many 3reel packets as the number of contributions you brought (no matter how large they were), on the cost*, directly from manufacturer. eg, if 60 people referred by you pledge even $1,00 each, you'll have the option to order up to 60 packets.

      *That will be much less than the $10,00 price placed here, as the biggest part of production costs will have already  been covered.

     

    2) When your friends contributions total $2,500.00 or more, you win one of the following viewers, in red or blue, accompanied by two reels.

     

    3) If your friend's contributions reach $5,000.00 or more, you get also one of the following books.

     

    4) And finally, the grand prize! The referrer that will bring in the most overall funding through his network, wins a trip to Greece for two, of an up to $6,000.00 total value!!*

    * Depending on your location. It includes air tickets for two, hotel in the vicinity of Delphi (single room), car and $150.00 per day, for 7 days.

     

    So, start sharing our campaign!Even one additional dollar can make the difference and make you the winner!

     

    Notice

    For a contributor to count as a referrer, you must promote our campaign with Indiegogo’s share tools while logged into your Indiegogo account. This is important because otherwise, your unique ID won’t be attached to any resulting contributions or visits.

    For more informations on how you can participate in our contest, see indiegogo's article here:

    https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles...

    *From our referral contest is excluded the backer that will claim the highest perk of $6,000.00 that is addressed only to companies.

story:
NOTE: Due to a technical roadblock, I have ended this campaign.  Please do not claim any perks.  

 

The battery handles in the video are rough prototypes.

The final battery handle cases and rosette mount will be high quality BLACK ANODIZED ALUMINIUM.  

 

What is the Camera Battery Handle?

NOTE FOR PANASONIC G85 USERS:  I will be adding a perk variation shortly that will have one of the 7V ports on the 9000mAh version upgraded to 9V so that the handle will work with the G85. 

It's an inexpensive, high capacity power solution for film makers.  The benefits of my Battery Handle are:

  1. Suitable for all camera types when used with a dummy battery.
  2. Can power multiple devices at once.
  3. Can connect directly onto the back of the Blackmagic Micro Cinema and Micro Studio cameras.
  4. Large battery charge indicator that gives accurate level reading and flashes when batteries need changing, (no more losing footage on Canon or Sony cameras when the battery goes dead, you get plenty of warning)
  5. High capacity at a low cost,
  6. There is a 9000mAh dual 7V output version and a 13000mAh 5x output version.  Each output has it's own, dedicated power regulator.
  7. Flexible rigging with a 1/4" mount built in and a rosette adapter is available so you can use it like a handle,
  8. Canon (LPE6) and Sony (NPF) battery plates are included so you can attach the battery bank directly to lights, monitors and other accessories - including directly onto the back of the Blackmagic Micro Cinema Camera,
  9. Fast and easy to swap out batteries no matter how the pack is rigged up.
  10. Main body made from black anodized aluminium and lid from hard wearing black abs plastic.

What you need to use the Battery Handle?

You will need the following things:

1 x battery handle (which you get here with the campaign)

4 or 3 x 18650 ion lithium batteries (button top).  You can order these here. 

1 x battery charger. Here is the charger I use, but there are a lot of chargers available.

The battery pack is a complete power solution and I recommend you get one (or the 9000mAh Battery Shell) for each device you wish to power. To expand your storage needs you only need to buy additional 18650 batteries which greatly reduces these cost of powering your equipment.

NOTE: the standard batteries I have suggested can support any 2 of the power ports at the same time because the batteries have a maximum discharge of 4.85A.  If you want to power all of the ports at the same time you can purchase higher discharge batteries here. 

A word of caution about batteries

Like so many products, there are fake and low quality batteries out there.  Only buy batteries from reputable sources and only buy a decent quality charger.  Batteries listed as 'protected' are better as they have built in safe guards. Protected aren't absolutely necessary as long as you use a quality charger that has overcharge protection and if you recharge the batteries when the battery pack's indicator starts flashing red.  As soon as you get a new set of batteries, charge them up (they should read 4.2V) and then run them on the camera.  If they last less than say 2.75 hours for a 3400mAh battery, then send them back.  Find a good source and stick with them.

    Why 18650 batteries

    These little power houses are widely available, inexpensive and have a high capacity.  Tesla has been using these little batteries in their cars and power walls.  As an example, 4x Panasonic 18650 cells cost under $30 and provide  up to 13,000mAh capacity - making this type of power solution more affordable than other solutions (equal to five LP6 batteries).  The plus side is you can replace individual cells if one degrades faster than the rest, rather than having to replace the entire unit.  These are the particular batteries I recommend as they have protection circuitry built in.

    Bonus Goal

    I have also developed a 9000mAh Battery Shell for use with devices where the handles are too big to fit.  If I reach $24,000, then I will enable an additional perk so you can get your hands on this useful addition.  The battery shell holds 3x 18650 batteries, has a large charge indicator, a 7V 2.5A dc out, and will include NPF and LP battery plates. 

    A bit about me

    I like to make stuff and I like to write and shoot films.  For the past two years, I've been making and selling remotes for the Blackmagic Micro Cinema camera (see below image) and now that I've bought the new BMPCC4K I'm making new things that I need for filming and that I'm sure other people will appreciate. I'm self taught in electronics, 3d industrial design, circuit board design and getting from prototypes to manufacturing. The money I've made from my remotes I've invested in my garage workshop, building copious amounts of prototypes, and hiring specialists to check and improve my designs. The things I make are pretty niche but I think this battery handle is unique and useful enough to have a wider appeal. We shall see!

    If you are interested in my current work, check out my website onelittlegoat.com.

    What is needed and what's in it for you

    Because the design is molded plastic and includes aluminium components and a circuit board, I need to get a lot made in order to keep the costs down. I've sourced the suppliers, all of whom I have already dealt with for my remotes, and I've made and tested the prototype.  All I need now is to get the minimum quantity made. 

    Because everything needs to be made at once, I'm offering a single, finished, professional quality product with included accessories.  These are:

    1 x Battery Handle (either 9000mAh or 13000mAh)

    1 x Canon LPN dummy battery plate

    1 x Sony NPF dummy battery plate

    1 x power cable for Blackmagic Pocket Cinema Camera 4k or a 5.5x2.1mm male to 5.5x2.1mm male cable

    Why I need you

    My work is purely small-scale for niche markets.  This product is something that can't be made on a case by case basis and requires a sizeable amount of cash up front - cash I do not possess.  Without your contribution this product won't be feasible. 

    Risks & Challenges

    I am supremely confident that this project will be completed to spec and on time.  I've been producing items for the past two years and I've formed good relationships with the companies and people that will be building the components.  I've spent a lot of time designing and redesigning this product. I am familiar with the costs for running the campaign and getting the product made and shipped.  I have ensured that all those costs are covered, plus a little extra  buffer - for the unforeseen.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    The most important thing is to spread the word.  There is so much going on all the time, it is easy for small players like myself to go unseen.

1 x Sony NPF dummy battery plate
1 x power cable for Blackmagic Pocket Cinema Camera 4k or a 5.5x2.1mm male to 5.5x2.1mm male cable

Why I need you

story:
Kas esu 

Esu kaunietis Mindaugas Urbikas ir kūriu video produkciją, filmuoju ir kūriu vestuvinius filmus, socialinių tinklų video turinį, dalyvauju socialinėse akcijose ir kartu jas inicijuoju. Šioje srityje dirbu jau 5 metai ir visus šiuos metus labai stipriai ir sparčiai augau tiek techniškai, tiek kaip kūrėjas, operatorius, montažo režisierius.
Mano VISUS viešintus darbus galite rasti čia: www.vimeo.com/urbikas

Pavogta įranga ir jos kaina

Vagystė įvyko muzikinio klipo filmavimas Ispanijoje kartu su atlikėja Eleonora Sebrova. Po dviejų dienų filmavimo visa "užgyventa" video įranga buvo išplėšta iš mašinos bagažinės nuvažiavus apžiūrėti filmavimo lokacijos. Nuostolio vertė 15 400 eurų.

  • Objektyvai:
    Sony 55mm F1.8 Z        550 €
    Sony 16-35 F4 Z             1300 €
    Sony PZ 16-105 F4 G    600 €
    Sony 24-70 F2.8 GM     2400 €
    Sony 70-200 F2.8 GM  2600 €
  • Kamera:
    Sony PXW FS5 MII         5000 €
  • Priedai:
    Išorinis monitorius Atomos Shogun 1200 €
    4 x SSD 500GB laikmenos                   400 €
    1 TB jau nufilmuotos, muzikos klipo medžiagos - neįkainojama
    Kameros stabilizatorius DJI Ronin MX 1000 €
    Lowepro Pro Tactic 450 kuprinė   200 €
    Kameros stovas, vienakojis (!!!)   150 €
    Bendra vagystės suma rinkos kainomis : 15 400 €

Ne visi daiktai buvo asmeniniai. Kamera ir 2 objektyvai buvo nuomoti Lietuvoje. Draudimas jiems neveikia, kadangi buvo išvežti iš Lietuvos ribų. Apie 8500 € yra skola nuomotojams, kurią reikia kuo greičiau padengti pinigais arba nauja, ta pačia įranga.

Kas manęs laukia

Mano kaip videografo sezonas prasideda jau gegužės mėnesį. Laukia žmonių suorganizuotos vestuvės ir šventės, pasirašytos sutartys dėl filmavimų, lenktynių sezonas ir suplanuotas dokumentinio filmo kūrimas apie jį. Asmeninę įrangos dalį stengsiuosi kuo greičiau susipirkti ir į sezoną grįžti su klientų lūkesčius atitinkančia įranga, kokybe. Klientų nuvilti nesiruošiu. Darysiu maksimaliai gerai, kaip tai dariau iki šiol. Už išnuomotus įrengimus teks atidirbti ir sumokėti. Bet tai nėra baisiausia, svarbu pradėti vėl filmuoti. Nenuleisti rankų ir nemesti savo kelio.

  • Pirmieji renginiai jau balandžio 25d.
  • Pirmosios vestuvės Gegužės 17d.
  • Sezono numatytų ir suplanuotų renginių skaičius:  27

Svarbiausi objektyvai kuriuos turiu susigrąžinti yra: 70-200 F2.8 GM, prieš tai man kainavęs 3000 €, 24-70 f2.8, 55mm F1.8 portretinis objektyvas, kameros stabilizatorius.
Jeigu nepavyks susigrąžinti, stengsiuosi kuo greičiau jiems užsidirbti nuomodamasis įrangą ir dirbdamas dar daugiau, dar strategiškiau ir efektyviau. 

#padekUrbikui

Visi, kurie mane pažįsta, žino kaip dirbu ir kiek savęs atiduodu darbui ir idėjai. Prisidėk tiek, kiek gali šiandien. Kiekvienas euras yra svarbus grįžti į darbus ir kūrybą.

Jeigu yra tekę dirbti su manimi ir ateityje norėtumėt vėl darbuotis kartu - padėk ir prisidėk. Kiekviena parama skaitoma kaip išankstinis avansas už vėlesnius gerus darbus! <3

Mano portfolio ir socialinės paskyros:

Mano VISUS viešintus darbus galite rasti čia:  www.vimeo.com/urbikas
Asmeninė socialinė paskyra: www.facebook.com/urbiss
Video produkcijos kūrėjo socialinė paskyra: www.facebook.com/urbikas.lt


Visa istorija ir V-log reportažas Facebook pranešime:

https://www.facebook.com/Urbiss/posts/102163132...
story_txt:
Kas esu 
Esu kaunietis Mindaugas Urbikas ir kūriu video produkciją, filmuoju ir kūriu vestuvinius filmus, socialinių tinklų video turinį, dalyvauju socialinėse akcijose ir kartu jas inicijuoju. Šioje srityje dirbu jau 5 metai ir visus šiuos metus labai stipriai ir sparčiai augau tiek techniškai, tiek kaip kūrėjas, operatorius, montažo režisierius.Mano VISUS viešintus darbus galite rasti čia: www.vimeo.com/urbikas
Pavogta įranga ir jos kaina
Vagystė įvyko muzikinio klipo filmavimas Ispanijoje kartu su atlikėja Eleonora Sebrova. Po dviejų dienų filmavimo visa "užgyventa" video įranga buvo išplėšta iš mašinos bagažinės nuvažiavus apžiūrėti filmavimo lokacijos. Nuostolio vertė 15 400 eurų.

story:
Once I had an idea of mixing a wooden camera with modern electronics. I was supported by my wife Anastasia and her friends who also liked this idea. Afterwards we decided to start development and promotion of the wooden camera project WooCama.


   What We Need

At the moment we are ordering all parts of the camera that are needed from different companies, though it is not quite convenient as it increases the production time and cost. With your help we hope to collect 10.000 dollar. The money will go to get equipment which will allow to speed up the production time of WooCama (Equipment includes thicknesser, milling machine, grinding machine, circular machine and exhaust unit). We also want to buy walnut wood in order to expand the range of materials we use.


   WooCama

WooCama will be an excellent gift for your friends. Also this ecologically friendly camera could become ‘the entrance ticket’ to an exciting world of photography for your children.


WooCama is made of walnut. Also some glass elements are used. The inside of the camera is a modern electronic filling from Nikon.


   What You Get


   Risks & Challenges

The production process is perfected and there won’t any problem with this. The only problem we expect is that due to the excessive amounts of orders (which we hope will happen), there could be a delay in production and delivery, in case of which we will contact you in advance and warn you. We will do our best to meet the deadline!


   Other Ways You Can Help

If you are currently not able to support the campaign financially, there are other ways to help:

Follow us

                                            

   Facebook        Pinterest        Instagram        YouTube           Twitter


Tell about us in different social networks.

We will be extremely thankful!

story:
In the last few years film photography has been growing in popularity for the first time since the 1990s. After digital photography came, the entire infrastructure supporting film photography shriveled up and nearly vanished completely. But today film has found a new relevance not only with those who enjoyed it in the past but to a whole new iPhone only generation. With this renewed interest, but no supporting infrastructure, there are problems arising. Almost all film cameras need servicing or repairing to keep going, and for 20 years very few have repaired their film cameras. Now we need to act to reach a sustainable situation with film cameras and that is why the Camera Rescue Project was created. If you are unaware of the project I suggest watching this mini documentary or browsing through the instagram feed.

--

During the last 9 years at the Camera Rescue project we have sourced and diagnosed over 70 000 cameras in Finland. Starting from one camera a day in the beginning, to about 100 cameras a day during the previous four months. And with all that has happened during this process, we have learned a great deal about what is the world of film cameras in 2020. This knowledge we want to now share with the global analog photography community.

Why share secrets we have taken years to learn?

Well there are two reasons.

 

1. We have no time to waste.
A few years ago there was 100 million film cameras in Europe alone unused, but the amount is diminishing by the day as 99% of the people do not care for analog photography and are typically unaware that there is a modern demand for these vintage items. In addition to cameras being tossed into garbage, from the ones that can be found in Europe around 80% are not working properly. Most of them can still be revived with proper care, or atleast used for parts. You might be the only person in your town that is looking to preserve film cameras and to rescue your towns cameras for the use of the community in the future, the cameras need to find their way to you.

When I started using and buying film cameras over a decade ago, the percentage of film cameras with problems was less than 10% (at least in Finland). The change to 80% being out of factory standards is drastic. If we want film photography to sustain itself in the following decades - we need to have 2-5 million working cameras in Europe alone. The number of working cameras is important because creating such a wealth of camera variety we have available now, will never be economically possible by making new cameras. And most likely new cameras entering the market in the future will be nowhere near as affordable as the options now.

Even if all the people working in Finland around this project would do all the tricks and growthhacks in the world, we cannot achieve to rescue several millions of cameras before it is too late. For the film market to be sustainable, rescuing cameras needs to be done by many many more people around the world.

2. We failed at our first attempt of making a global solution

One of the goals when we setup the Camera Rescue project was to find not only solutions for Finland or the Nordics, but scalable solutions that could be used by the community globally. Naturally, like any millennials, we thought it would best be done by creating an app. Sadly we are not coders and even worse at picking coding companies to work for us. 

Our first idea was to multiply our knowhow through an app that would connect people that haven't used their film camera in decades to people and companies that want film cameras. It’s already past the two year mark from what was supposed to be the beta release date. We have run out of both patience and funds on this and have decided we probably have reached the point where its time to move on and label it as a fail and a valuable learning experience. And before you email me with solution provider info, I don't even want to think about the app world for now.

But as I have been pondering on what to do next, I got to thinking about what I can actually do. My grandfather was a teacher, my mother and father both have been teachers, and as I have been sharing information about photography online for my whole life I think it is fair to say that I have an ability to teach as well. In October I asked the CR instagram followers what they thought of the idea of a basic course online and as the response was so positive here we are crowdfunding the execution.

Here is some of the team working in the project this September in front of the Rescue Center in Tampere Finland that houses the main operations.
 

What will you learn?

This course will teach you all the basics so that you can rescue cameras. As I have hunted for cameras in three continents and all types of situations during the last decade, I can confirm the course will be universally applicable - not just a series of tips for Finland. The sections covered will be:

  1. Why would you want to rescue cameras?
  2. What to look for? Part A - The Cameras
  3. What to look for? Part B - The Condition of a Camera
  4. Where to look for hidden cameras? (Online and in the real world)
  5. What can I repair in a camera?
  6. Where and how to sell cameras?

 

The goal of the course and how we will get there

To really understand how the whole Camera Rescue process works and how you could do it too, there would be at least 12-15 distinct video classes. All made in the same production quality as the kickstarter video above, but at a slower more appropriate pace.

The majority of the classes will focus on the only mistake that really matters, but that you will keep making - knowing the condition of the camera. Most of us are so old, that our natural reaction to a film camera is to expect it to work. That is not the case in 2020 anymore, but it is a very hard habit to kick.

With help from Cameramakers, the camera repair team in our project with over 50 years of experience repairing cameras, we will go through all the main analog camera types and show you why and how they notice the flaw of cameras with their actual testing machinery. Cameramakers have perfected the art of condition checking so far, that they make mistakes in less than 1 out of 300 cameras. Then we go through the best practices of what you can do to mimic the process, without such machinery.

The main goal is that you will not buy a faulty camera again, without knowing it is faulty. This is important because knowing if a camera is working will enable you know exactly what you should or should not pay for it.


 

The budget

Making these videos will disrupt many of our daily processes, but as I stated above we cannot keep analog photography alive if the amount of cameras circulating worldwide is not big enough.  However it would be good to cover the expenses of the video productions - to keep both the quality high and actually get these out there faster than if we would do also editing etc ourselves.

We have a quote for the 15 video course from a production company that is sympathetic to the cause. To that we have to add taxes and the crowdfunding website fees, but all in all we can go ahead with the course if we reach 15 000€. Here in Finland this price is very fair for the quality and quantity we would receive.

 


Topics to cover:

 

1. Why rescue cameras?

  • Rescuing heritage
  • Monoculture of the digital camera vs the abundance of choices in film cameras
  • Incredible results for the money
  • Circular economy at its best
  • The possibility of making a profit on the cameras

2. What to look for Part A - The camera

  • PRICE: User value, Collection value and Parts value
  • TYPE Different camera types and models
    • The Antique Cameras
    • The Compact Cameras
    • The SLRs
    • The Rangefinders
    • The TLRs
    • The Medium Format Cameras
    • The Instant Cameras
    • Large Format Cameras
  • Rules of thumb to determine value
  • The easiest finds - The lenses

3)  What to look for Part B - The condition

  • Why 90% of the cameras value is in its condition.
  • How people commonly check their cameras - and why it is wrong.
  • How to check a cameras functions properly?
  • Tools necessary for checking cameras at home - The Check Pack
  • How to check a lens?

4) How to find cameras?

The places selling cameras from user to user

The places that have the real gems and deals and how to reach them

5) Can I repair a camera?

The three levels of work on a camera - repairing, fixing and maintenance - and which ones of them you can do at home.

  • Light seal replacement.
  • Cleaning battery compartments
  • Replacing leathers
  • Cleaning the outside of the camera
  • Getting battery adapters
  • How to find information on doing repairs.
  • Why should actual repairs be left for people with the right knowhow and tools.

6) Where and how to sell cameras.

  • How to rate the condition of a camera
  • How to take good sales pictures
  • Online vs face to face
  • When to sell a camera
  • Selling cameras in bulk


Timetables

We are entering a very hectic 2020 with the Camera Rescue project. We still aim to rescue 100 000 cameras by the end of the year and it means we should process about 30 000 cameras in 12 months. That will mean search tours around Europe, taking part in fairs, hiring a big summer team, looking for additional space to process all the cameras etc.

But January still seems relatively slow and the first two weeks of February too. So I could record these lessons then and release them one by one once they come out of the editing room. Later in the year there will be no time to record this course and I believe many of you want to get going rescuing cameras in your own area sooner rather than later. With the funding all lessons should be recorded within a month of the end of this campaign and start coming out by late February.

The risks

This is not the first time I am doing a photography related YouTube series. Quite a while ago I founded Kamerakoulu.fi - An Online Photography School in Finnish and did a YouTube basic course of 14 lessons in Finnish. Six years later the technical quality and knowhow would now be much better, the homework would be a bit more complex than posting photos on Flickr (it was the place in 2013) and the content would be perfected with the masters of each area from Cameramakers.com or Kamerastore.com. So in short - the risks of us not delivering what promised with the funding - should be almost none if I am not hit by a bus.

 

Why should I support?

This course is aimed to keep as many cameras away from dumpsters or electronic recycling as possible. The more cameras we have in circulation, the better the future of film looks like. And having more cameras in the market means the prices will remain lower for longer. In addition even the most experienced camera nerds will benefit from these two things:

  1. Going through the basics systematically is always good. If one little trick saves you from paying for a lemon, you will be thankful that you took the course. Every film photographer I know, including myself, has made a bad camera purchase they couldn’t undo and lost money because of it.
  2.  We want new people to come to film photography, so that film manufacturing is viable. If they need to buy 3 or 4 cameras before they actually find one that gives them results, they will quit before they even started. By helping funding the course, the free material will be available online for all - newcomers now and in years to come can use it to find their way into the camera world.

 

Other ways to help


Spreading the word is actually the main help you can give to this project. As a course about film cameras has never been available online, I honestly cannot say if there is an interest online for this type of material. If you would like to see it become a reality - please do take action.

I am so excited that the camera rescue project could help the analog photography scene globally with this course and am very grateful for all the support!
 



PS. There is more info about the perks in the FAQ

How to check a lens?
4) How to find cameras?The places selling cameras from user to userThe places that have the real gems and deals and how to reach them5) Can I repair a camera?The three levels of work on a camera - repairing, fixing and maintenance - and which ones of them you can do at home.
Light seal replacement.
Cleaning battery compartments
Replacing leathers
Cleaning the outside of the camera
Getting battery adapters
How to find information on doing repairs.
Why should actual repairs be left for people with the right knowhow and tools.
6) Where and how to sell cameras.
How to rate the condition of a camera
How to take good sales pictures
Online vs face to face
When to sell a camera
Selling cameras in bulk
TimetablesWe are entering a very hectic 2020 with the Camera Rescue project. We still aim to rescue 100 000 cameras by the end of the year and it means we should process about 30 000 cameras in 12 months. That will mean search tours around Europe, taking part in fairs, hiring a big summer team, looking for additional space to process all the cameras etc.But January still seems relatively slow and the first two weeks of February too. So I could record these lessons then and release them one by one once they come out of the editing room. Later in the year there will be no time to record this course and I believe many of you want to get going rescuing cameras in your own area sooner rather than later. With the funding all lessons should be recorded within a month of the end of this campaign and start coming out by late February.The risksThis is not the first time I am doing a photography related YouTube series. Quite a while ago I founded Kamerakoulu.fi - An Online Photography School in Finnish and did a YouTube basic course of 14 lessons in Finnish. Six years later the technical quality and knowhow would now be much better, the homework would be a bit more complex than posting photos on Flickr (it was the place in 2013) and the content would be perfected with the masters of each area from Cameramakers.com or Kamerastore.com. So in short - the risks of us not delivering what promised with the funding - should be almost none if I am not hit by a bus. Why should I support?This course is aimed to keep as many cameras away from dumpsters or electronic recycling as possible. The more cameras we have in circulation, the better the future of film looks like. And having more cameras in the market means the prices will remain lower for longer. In addition even the most experienced camera nerds will benefit from these two things:
Going through the basics systematically is always good. If one little trick saves you from paying for a lemon, you will be thankful that you took the course. Every film photographer I know, including myself, has made a bad camera purchase they couldn’t undo and lost money because of it.
 We want new people to come to film photography, so that film manufacturing is viable. If they need to buy 3 or 4 cameras before they actually find one that gives them results, they will quit before they even started. By helping funding the course, the free material will be available online for all - newcomers now and in years to come can use it to find their way into the camera world.
 Other ways to helpSpreading the word is actually the main help you can give to this project. As a course about film cameras has never been available online, I honestly cannot say if there is an interest online for this type of material. If you would like to see it become a reality - please do take action.I am so excited that the camera rescue project could help the analog photography scene globally with this course and am very grateful for all the support! PS. There is more info about the perks in the FAQ

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jeff Whiting, and a few months ago I began a journey to expand my photography hobby in a unique direction. With my Mavic Mini drone, I started to get unique images captured that offered uncommon views of the local area. It was a lot of fun, and I have aspirations of eventually turning it into a commercial endeavor. Unfortunately, a few weeks ago I got a little risky with a shot and the unit disconnected and crashed in a place that I was not able to recover it from.

I very much would like to get back into the air and continue my journey to go higher, see farther, and share my aerial adventures with others. I've built an Instagram following of over a thousand users and am running out of new content to post.

Droning is a fairly challenging hobby to be involved in. If it was easy, everyone would be doing it. Crashing is an unfortunate occurrence, and I experienced it fairly early in my progression. The sooner I can get back to flying, the better pilot I’ll be in the long run. 

What I Need & What You Get

A new Mavic Mini will set me back a little over $400. Anything I get will go toward the purchase of a new drone. If, by some miracle, more was raised, I would get the Fly-More combo with the extra batteries and prop guards. I could also use a new SD card, since I lost the last one, as it was inside the drone. If I raise less than the amount needed, I’ll hold it while I raise the rest, but it will only be used for the purchase of a new drone.

As a thank-you for contributing, you can get some high-res versions of the photo work I’ve already done in the form of a comic-style book and poster prints, which are suitable for framing.

The Impact

It’s hard to be a drone pilot without a drone! Taking the next step to resuming taking pictures in the air starts here. Eventually I would like the hobby to become commercial enough that it will be self-sustaining.

Risks & Challenges

There is little to no risk at all with this project. I already have a large library of aerial photos captured and processed, so I just need to arrange them in a book format. I’ll use the same printer who does my comic books. If you make a contribution, the cost of the printed good is covered, and you will receive them.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Follow me on Instagram and like my photos! I can be found at /movingin360.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, My name is Jack Avon, you will likely see from my online profiles that I have done many things, worked in finance, played competitive sports, written books amongst others. What you may not see is that I have always been an avid photographer all my life, and self confessed gadget guy. I love electronic compenants, I like cameras, I like mobile phones. Now I have become an electronics technician and decided to start my own business fixing standalone cameras and also mobile phones from all systems. So I get to do all the stuff I love, whilst making sure I do something for people.

This campaign is so important to me because it signals the final change and completion of my life aims. Which is be involved in fixing stuff like camera and phones, and to work with people all around the world giving them something they may have felt they lost. Having the commercial, financial and technical experience to run such a business is fine, but I will need to establish a working physical workshop which needs to be equipped with the repair and testing tools.

This is where I am thanking you for your contribution to making this dream happen. I am firmly convinced that it will become the most well known and preferred reapair shop globally in a matter of a few years, and I would sincerely like to have you with me on that journey.

What We Need & What You Get

I am looking for £57,000 in funding, the breakdown of wish is below:

- Purchase of workshop and studio - £32,000

- Renovations and custimisation of workshop - £5,000

- Testing and reapir tools - £4,000

- Acquire Manufacturers Service Adjustment software & licences (Nikon, Canon, Pentax, Olympus, Leica, Sony, Panasonic, Fujifilm, Samsung, Apple, Hauwei, Motorola) = 80 Items  & $200 Per item - $16,000

In return I am giving some perks to those who can fund at various levels based on repair free of 1 camera and 1 phone for the individual and 2 names people. The perks will start with:

1 Year free repairs and garantee. (Under £50 per contribution)

3 years free repairs and garantee. (Under £100, above £50 per contribution)

10 Years free repairs and garantee. (Between £100 - £500 per contribution)

Lifetime free repairs and garantee. (Aboive £500 per contribution)

If I dont reach the total goal, the funds will go toward the most urgent need which is the workshop.

The Impact

The mobile phone is the most verstaile and high valued item carried on the person in the world, and is the dominant means of communications and access to the world for more than 3 billion people. The problem is the average failure and breakage rates for all phone manufacturers is 2 years, down from 4 years in 2015. What this means is most peoples phones will either be damaged or have some major failure within 24 months of purchase, and this is getting more acute. Its the same for standalone cameras. Since cameras went digital we expect to see a new camera with some failures within the first 15 months from purchase. There are some serious reasons why we need to think about re-use through repair and make this a future aspiration.

One reason is the only 30% of redundant cameras and phone will actually be recycled, and of the 70% that cannot be reycled effectively most of that is not bio-degradeable.

Another reason is manufacturers of these items, have an in-built reliance for repairs in their revenue streams. This is a conflict of interest, because it wont force them to make more robust equipment in te future

A third reason is when we cannot repair items cost effectively, we will offer to buy the item from the customer for a notinal fee, refurbish it at our cost, and redistribute freely to areas of the world in deprivation. This is stated aim, not an aspiration, and I would expect you to hold us to it.

Risks & Challenges

I will admit there are risks. These are mainly financial. In order to make this project work, I will need to eb able to maintain a financial survival for the business. I dont intend to draw any money from the business, until it has an EBIT over 30% per annum, so projections are i wont be paid for the first two years of operation.

The other risk will be response from manufacturers who are concertedly trying to drive out repair businesses from the market, and forcing consumers into taking out expensing equipment insurances which are not garanteed as revenue stream

For both these risk challenges I see it being prepared and have a definate strategy on how to solve these. I cannot state these in this arena, but needless to say I will be actively pursing retailers and giving them repair garantees to use us, taking it away from manucaturers.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, but like what you have heard, there are other ways of being very effective which would really help such as

Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign, and lets have some fun.

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please...

  • Make some noise about Halo 360°.
  • Share Halo 360° on all social media venues.
  • Tell your local Police Department about us.
  • Tell your local news station.
  • Spread the word about Halo 360°.


Personal Message from the CEO:

Inventifi and it's team decided to come to Indiegogo because of the reputation and reach that Indiegogo has. We believe that it's members want to see new and exciting ideas being introduced that can truly have an impact. That is why we decided to go with "All-or-Nothing" funding platform, also known as "Fixed". We did this because we don't believe in just taking your hard earned money, and not providing you with a finished product. For instance, if we were to get $50,000 dollars, we wouldn't be able to deliver our promise to you...a finished product called Halo 360°. With your help, we will change the world of law enforcement. If you have any questions about how something works, or just want more clarification, please email me personally at solutions@inventifi.com. Again, on behalf of Inventifi and it's team, we thank you for the continued support we have gotten so far, and will continue to get.

An Immense Thank You,

-James Lackemeyer Inventifi CEO









    Disclaimer:

    Music, graphics and photographs are used in conjunction with the correct creative commons clause applicable to the aforementioned music, graphic, photograph, and image search engines. We here at Inventifi, LLC would like to thank the contributors for their work which we take no ownership of. If you would like to find out who these works are by, please go to our website under tab "Shout Out" tab to see the contributor.
story_txt:
Who is Inventifi?
Inventifi is a new LLC 
start-up comprised of your average 9-5, hard working individuals.  We 
have a large portfolio of inventions that we believe will help improve 
the lives of the general public, in both small and large ways.  Our 
overall business plan is built upon the moral foundation instilled in us
 by our families.  We believe that we are a community, and when one 
succeeds they should lend a helping hand to the next person.  Therefore,
 we strive to align all our products with an applicable charity, 
donating a portion of the revenue.  Although we are never short on 
ideas, we have hit a road block in regards to money and resources, and 
can’t move our products beyond the basic prototype.  We have day jobs 
like everyone else, so we put in our 9-5, then it is back to the drawing
 board for our company and products. We decided to come to you, the 
general public on Indiegogo to jump start our company with our first 
product, Halo 360°. 












What is Halo 360°?
Halo 360° is a 
patent-pending, revolutionary new device for law enforcement that 
consists of multiple high-definition wide lens video cameras with an 
internal hard drive and streaming features to capture a continuous 360° 
video recording.  This device is manufactured with the ultimate goal of 
creating full accountability by recording every interaction, routine and
 non-routine, between the general public and police.  This is achieved by 
the following standard features, that can be upgraded if need be to 
include:
	Standard Features:




High-definition 360° video recording
Voice Recognition
Remote video and audio streaming
Secure and encrypted data files
Live and play-back video feed
Password protected editing/deleting capabilities 


Optional Features: 	

Global positioning system

Night-vision
Language translation services
Bluetooth sync with body and dashboard cameras (integrated)
Infrared lighting





 




Why do we need Halo 360°?
Recent events in 
Ferguson, New York City and Baltimore underscore the need for unbiased, 
tamper proof photographic evidence of all incidences.  This protects the
 individuals, witnesses, and police officers by removing any 
undercurrent of bias that plagues the system and subsequent testimony.  
By providing an accurate recording, all parties are protected and 
details corroborated that could be missed in a high stress environment. 
 Safety is the number one priority for all parties, and thus Halo 360° 
offers voice recognition to key phrases, allowing for back up or 
ambulance services to be notified.  Dispatch will be able to actively 
monitor all situations remotely, allowing for quick reaction if needed. 
To further aid in communication, safety, and translational barriers 
between law enforcement and the public.




 




Who benefits?

In short, everybody benefits from Halo 360°.  Safety and accountability 
for both the public and law enforcement is paramount and Halo 360° will 
provide an independent means of achieving this ultimate goal.  By 
creating a device that captures unbiased data via video, all parties’ 
rights and testimonies are protected and further corroborated.  Both 
audio and visual recordings would be admissible in court, allowing for 
potentially irrefutable proof of innocence or guilt.  In lines with our 
business mission statement, a portion of the revenue will be donated to 
the families of police officers killed in the line of duty, and 
community projects.




 





Why is this better than current technology?

Currently, dashboard and body cameras are the only means to 
record encounters between individuals and law enforcement.  These 
technologies are severely limited due to the narrow camera angle and 
proximity to the officer.  By providing the first 360° fully circular 
camera view mounted on a patrol vehicle, both parties are protected from
 false allegations and/or erroneous memory.




 






How is the video data stream protected?

Audio and video recordings from Halo 360° will be recorded and 
compressed, and uploaded to a hard drive at a separate location from the
 device.  The raw data file can only be edited and/or deleted upon prior
 approval from the Chief of Police or designated authority to ensure 
data integrity and chain of custody which will be maintained in a read-only audit trail. Recorded data will be stored however long the client (police department or city officials) deem necessary. Data will be encrypted upon request from client utilizing Halo 360°.






Will this be expanded for use outside of law enforcement?

Yes!  We envision numerous Halo 360° models to meet many 
different markets.  These include the following to enhance the patent pending Halo 
360° high definition camera configuration with remote streaming and 
specialty mount for either automobile or motorcycle:

	Consumer Model:

Sync compatibility with home network
Increased internal hard drive storage
Decreased insurance rates due to enhanced motor safety features

Military Model:

Teflon coating and dust resistant seals
Solid-state hard drive
Encrypted data to military standards

Night vision
Secure bandwidth feeds
Thermal heat map
Enemy detection capability
Shock and shatter resistant casing
Any features required by military use will be complied with



Obstacles and how we plan to over come them:

Obstacle One:Hiring developers to help out with software design for Halo 360°. To develop the protocol to run the remote connection from the Police Dispatch Headquarters. We plan to overcome this by contacting the best developers for our software’s needs to develop all the key features of Halo 360°. This includes the voice recognition feature as well.Obstacle Two:Light pollution from the extremely bright police emergency lights on the roof of the car.We plan on using lens’ hoods to factor out light where we can and decide optimal mounting areas per police car emergency lights set-ups. Plus, an opaque housing for Halo 360° to reduce light pollution.Obstacle Three:Mounting apparatus to be able to mount onto existing or in the process of being built police cars. Depending on the set-up of the police car, different police cars have different emergency lights. We will work to develop a “universal” mount that can be used on all police cars.

Final Thought:
Inventifi and it's team would like to extend our hand. If you have any questions, comments, concerns, or additional features you would like to share and see added to Halo 360°, please feel free to contact us.
Also, please come visit us at Inventifi, look around, and see what we are all about.
Thank you for your continued support.
 Other Ways You Can Help If you can't donate, please...  Make some noise about Halo 360°.
 Share Halo 360° on all social media venues.
Tell your local Police Department about us.
Tell your local news station.
Spread the word about Halo 360°.


Personal Message from the CEO:
Inventifi and it's team decided to come to Indiegogo because of the reputation and reach that Indiegogo has. We believe that it's members want to see new and exciting ideas being introduced that can truly have an impact. That is why we decided to go with "All-or-Nothing" funding platform, also known as "Fixed". We did this because we don't believe in just taking your hard earned money, and not providing you with a finished product. For instance, if we were to get $50,000 dollars, we wouldn't be able to deliver our promise to you...a finished product called Halo 360°. With your help, we will change the world of law enforcement. If you have any questions about how something works, or just want more clarification, please email me personally at solutions@inventifi.com. Again, on behalf of Inventifi and it's team, we thank you for the continued support we have gotten so far, and will continue to get.
An Immense Thank You,
-James Lackemeyer Inventifi CEO 

Disclaimer:
Music,
 graphics and photographs are used in conjunction with the correct 
creative commons clause applicable to the aforementioned music, graphic, photograph, and image search engines. We here at Inventifi, LLC would like to thank the 
contributors for their work which we take no ownership of. If you would 
like to find out who these works are by, please go to our website under 
tab "Shout Out" tab to see the contributor.

story:
What is CamScan and how it was created

Like many people that happened to hold a camera in their hands in the time of "analog" photography, I ended up with a couple of shoe boxes full of film rolls and some envelopes with cut film. Some of the images were printed but quite significant amount never were. And I thought: "What should i do to make it all digital?". I tried small cheap film scanners with no success. Then I tried a dedicated flatbed scanner which, according to reviews, should have produced good results. The quality of the scans was indeed pretty good but there were quite some drawbacks: I got overexposed scans and I couldn't influence it, i couldn't shoot in RAW and it was tremendously slow. It took about five minutes to get one good scan.

I was almost ready to send my films to some specialized service which would cost me a lot but then I thought: "Hang on! I have a good digital camera. Why don't I use it to scan my films?"

It was not a completely novel idea but none of the devices I found on the internet seemed good enough to make me buy it.

After some research, tests and brainstorms with friends I came up with a device that converts a camera into a film scanner.

These are the key features that this device has:

- It is very fast

- It keeps the film firmly in focus

- It provides great quality scans (as good as your camera)

- It features a high quality LED light source with a great CRI

- The film is firmly clamped which help to keep the negative in focus

- You have full control over exposure and color (shooting in RAW)

- It is compact and you can disassemble to make it even more compact for storage

- There is no need to send your precious negatives anywhere

- No messing with frames

- No need to cut film rolls

About speed and quality

No doubt that a professional film scanner would do a great job both quality- and speed-wise. However prices of such devices start at about 500 euro and sky is the limit. Sending you negatives to be scanned is an option too but, if you have many of them, you are going to spend hundreds of euros for this service.

Simple and cheap (from 40 to 100 euro) table-top scanners are pretty fast if you don't count the time you need to squeeze you film into a plastic frame. But the quality of scans is unsurprisingly crappy. 

Dedicated flatbed scanners (those with a special adapters to scan films) are not so bad quality-wise since the resolution is usually decent. But the speed is nothing but disappointment - five minutes to scan a single negative. And you have the trouble of plastic frames here as well.

With CamScan your scan is as good as your camera-lens combination. You shoot fast because it's nothing more than just pressing a button.

Below you can see the very same negative scanned in three ways.

Small and simple table-top scanner:

Dedicated flatbed scanner:

CamScan combined with Canon EOS 700D and post-processed in LightRoom:

What We Need & What You Get

A prototype is already built and tested. Now we only need to make a few finishing touches and get enough backers to start producing the CamScan.

Be sure that your camera fulfills the following:

  • Able to shoot in RAW
  • Has a standard tripod mount centrally located with respect to the lens. Basically the mount must be right under the lens optical center when you look at your camera from the front.
  • Is able to focus at 16-27 cm from the tripod mount. And being at this distance it should have a standard film frame (36x24mm) occupying a significant part of the field of view. These two requirements mean either a macro lens or a macro-ring with auto-focus. I personally use this combination: Canon EOS 700D; EF 50mm 1:1.8 STM lens; 12mm auto-focus extension ring.

You can also use your smartphone if:

  • it can shoot in RAW; iPhone 6s and above with iOS10 and above has it for sure; several Android phones can do it too: just google "Android phones that take RAW photos"
  • it can focus at 6 to 14 cm from a subject having a standard negative (36x24mm) occupying most of the final digital image. Most of smartphones can focus at this distance but many have a enough zoom. You will need a clamp-on macro lens to to achieve a good optical zoom. Alternatively you can use you phone "as is" and crop images afterwards which will inevitably cost you some quality.

If you plan using your smartphone don't forget to order a smartphone adapter together with your CamScan.

You will also need some editing software able to open RAW images, invert colors and edit RGB channels. LightRoom, Photoshop or Capture One are just right for the job but there are other programs around having this functionality.

The "why"

The glorious era of film photography is gone or, at least, is about to end. I find it important that the best images from the past make it to the new digital world.

Everybody with film rolls in a shoe box is invited to back this project and get CamScan in return. It's good stuff!

Whether you want to get CamScan for yourself or not, please share this project with anybody who might be interested!

Cheers,

Ilja Malakhovsky & Co-developers

P.P.S. A little explanation on different configurations

The most complete option - "CamScan LED + film drum" - has all you might need scanning 35mm film and slides. There is a built-in LED and a handy drum for film rolls. 

The "CamScan LED" has the same but the drum. Choose this one if all or most of your films are cut in stripes.

Another two options - "CamScan Bare" and "CamScan Bare + film drum" are the same as the two above but they don't have a built-in light source. You might prefer one of these two options if you have a source already (an external flash, for example) or you plan to use natural light.

If you want to be able to scan 120-film, you need to order  "Clamp + drum for MF" or  "Clamp + drum for MF" additionally.

Same holds for the "Smartphone adapter" -  it is an extra option.

 

P.P.S. Check here the tutorials on a color correction of scanned negatives.

In Lightroom:

and in Photoshop:

 

P.P.P.S. For sure you can order a negative scanner in a configuration that suits you most but you can also support us by ordering T-shirts, mugs and buttons (check out the perks on the right). The T-shirt images in a more decent resolution are here:
story_txt:
What is CamScan and how it was created
Like many people that happened to hold a camera in their hands in the time of "analog" photography, I ended up with a couple of shoe boxes full of film rolls and some envelopes with cut film. Some of the images were printed but quite significant amount never were. And I thought: "What should i do to make it all digital?". I tried small cheap film scanners with no success. Then I tried a dedicated flatbed scanner which, according to reviews, should have produced good results. The quality of the scans was indeed pretty good but there were quite some drawbacks: I got overexposed scans and I couldn't influence it, i couldn't shoot in RAW and it was tremendously slow. It took about five minutes to get one good scan.
I was almost ready to send my films to some specialized service which would cost me a lot but then I thought: "Hang on! I have a good digital camera. Why don't I use it to scan my films?"
It was not a completely novel idea but none of the devices I found on the internet seemed good enough to make me buy it.After some research, tests and brainstorms with friends I came up with a device that converts a camera into a film scanner.These are the key features that this device has:
- It is very fast
- It keeps the film firmly in focus
- It provides great quality scans (as good as your camera)
- It features a high quality LED light source with a great CRI
- The film is firmly clamped which help to keep the negative in focus
- You have full control over exposure and color (shooting in RAW)
- It is compact and you can disassemble to make it even more compact for storage
- There is no need to send your precious negatives anywhere
- No messing with frames
- No need to cut film rolls
About speed and quality
No doubt that a professional film scanner would do a great job both quality- and speed-wise. However prices of such devices start at about 500 euro and sky is the limit. Sending you negatives to be scanned is an option too but, if you have many of them, you are going to spend hundreds of euros for this service.
Simple and cheap (from 40 to 100 euro) table-top scanners are pretty fast if you don't count the time you need to squeeze you film into a plastic frame. But the quality of scans is unsurprisingly crappy. 
Dedicated flatbed scanners (those with a special adapters to scan films) are not so bad quality-wise since the resolution is usually decent. But the speed is nothing but disappointment - five minutes to scan a single negative. And you have the trouble of plastic frames here as well.

Able to shoot in RAW
Has a standard tripod mount centrally located with respect to the lens. Basically the mount must be right under the lens optical center when you look at your camera from the front.
Is able to focus at 16-27 cm from the tripod mount. And being at this distance it should have a standard film frame (36x24mm) occupying a significant part of the field of view. These two requirements mean either a macro lens or a macro-ring with auto-focus. I personally use this combination: Canon EOS 700D; EF 50mm 1:1.8 STM lens; 12mm auto-focus extension ring.

it can shoot in RAW; iPhone 6s and above with iOS10 and above has it for sure; several Android phones can do it too: just google "Android phones that take RAW photos"

it can focus at 6 to 14 cm from a subject having a standard negative (36x24mm) occupying most of the final digital image. Most of smartphones can focus at this distance but many have a enough zoom. You will need a clamp-on macro lens to to achieve a good optical zoom. Alternatively you can use you phone "as is" and crop images afterwards which will inevitably cost you some quality.

If you plan using your smartphone don't forget to order a smartphone adapter together with your CamScan.
You will also need some editing software able to open RAW images, invert colors and edit RGB channels. LightRoom, Photoshop or Capture One are just right for the job but there are other programs around having this functionality.

The "why"
The glorious era of film photography is gone or, at least, is about to end. I find it important that the best images from the past make it to the new digital world.
Everybody with film rolls in a shoe box is invited to back this project and get CamScan in return. It's good stuff!
Whether you want to get CamScan for yourself or not, please share this project with anybody who might be interested!
Cheers,
Ilja Malakhovsky & Co-developers
P.P.S. A little explanation on different configurations
The most complete option - "CamScan LED + film drum" - has all you might need scanning 35mm film and slides. There is a built-in LED and a handy drum for film rolls. 
The "CamScan LED" has the same but the drum. Choose this one if all or most of your films are cut in stripes.
Another two options - "CamScan Bare" and "CamScan Bare + film drum" are the same as the two above but they don't have a built-in light source. You might prefer one of these two options if you have a source already (an external flash, for example) or you plan to use natural light.
If you want to be able to scan 120-film, you need to order  "Clamp + drum for MF" or  "Clamp + drum for MF" additionally.
Same holds for the "Smartphone adapter" -  it is an extra option.

story:
Hi there! Let me introduce to you:

PocketCam, the world's smallest action camera. Don't carry around a chunky camera when you're on your adventures. You won't even realize PocketCam is on you with its 4.5 cm by 4.5 cm tiny casing and 22 grams feather-like weight. Capture life's memories with this small, but powerful, action camera.

 

 

PocketCam is designed to be as user-friendly as possible. You can easily take selfies with the click of the button, or use the integrated app for hands-free selfies! Featuring a super-wide angle f.20 aperture lense, PocketCam is able to take beautiful shots in both daylight and nighttime.

 

 

Featuring an IP68-certified waterproof casing, PocketCam guarantees protection in 10-meter deep water for a full hour. Whether you're exploring the deep seas or just accidentally dropped PocketCam into the pool, you can rest assured it's safe.

 

Countless ways to mount PocketCam. Capture memories everywhere you go.

 

 

PocketCam Includes 4 modes of media capture: photo, video, timelapse, and slo-mo. Using the app or the device itself, choose between 1080P / 60 fps or 720P / 120 fps for different occasions. Then, if needed, switch between modes on the app to convert your recorded video into other modes for viewing.

 

Let PocketCam do the thinking for you. PocketCam can auto-detect environment cues and optimize pictures to match optimal colour, contrast, and saturation levels. This way, you are able to move between bright and dark environments without having to adjust camera settings.

 

Record 1 hour of nonstop video with PocketCam's built-in lithium battery. If you run out, PocketCam continues to capture while charging, making sure you don't miss any important shots.

Packed with a professional SLR-grade F2.0 aperture lense, 6G sapphire multi-layer filter, and a Sony 1/3.2 Inch 3rd generation sensor, PocketCam is able to capture breathtaking, crystal clear images and videos.

 

1080P/120 recording, high definition photography, mode enhancement, auto low-light mode, panaroma, and timelapse are just some of the features PocketCam is packed with, making sure that you are ready to capture memories at any moment.

 

Ever wish you had night vision? Well, we came quite close. With low light mode, PocketCam is able to film and capture in darker environments. Shooting at night just became a whole lot easier.

 

Instantly share photos and videos to social media via Wi-Fi or Bluetooth. Live streaming compatible.

 

Mount your PocketCam to everyday surfaces and control it using the PocketCam app. Take beautiful hands-free pictures by setting a 3, 5, or 10-second timer.  

 

Traditional helmets are 200-350 grams. When a helmet surpasses 260 grams, significant pressure is placed on the neck and shoulder. PocketCam reduces the overall helmet load by 50 grams, eliminating unnecessary stress.

 

 

Wholesale options available. Inquire at hello [@] pocketcam.io

 

 

We're a team based in Vancouver, Canada aimed to disrupt the action camera industry. Each component and design has been meticulously chosen and crafted, ensuring that our final masterpiece is of something truly unique and powerful.

We believe that with the support of Indiegogo and all our loyal backers, we will be able to bring PocketCam to life.

Check us out @ www.pocketcam.io

If you have any questions, feel free to email us: hello [@] pocketcam.io

story:
Media still pending? Rendering error?

Let's face it. Backing up, transferring, and organizing media files is a constant hassle for people in the creative field.

You’re on location, trying to move with ease, yet your gear bag is stuffed to the brim with hard disks, a cumbersome laptop, and more. And then there’s the long wait for your media to transcode … 

it’s a process designed to kill the creative spirit.

Well, no more.

With this groundbreaking, portable device, we’re giving you back your creative freedom. Octoplus eliminates the complicated file backup and transcoding processes you’ve forced yourself to accept, enabling you to safely and efficiently store your valuable footage and precious memories on the go — without a computer or a smartphone.

So leave the laptop at home. Stop buying SD cards after SD cards. The Octoplus simplifies everything, empowering you to focus on your creativity.

 

Our singular mission is to keep your data safe and fully intact. That’s why the Octoplus features dual SSD slots for RAID 1 redundancy backup, ensuring your files stay secure and uncorrupted, no matter what. As an added precaution, BLAKE2 Checksum Integration uses a hash algorithm to guarantee error-free copies.

 

Thanks to its high-performance SSDs, the Octoplus can transfer data at a rate of up to 2100MB per second — that means it only takes one minute to back up 128 GB! And if you need to use the integrated UHS-II SD card reader, you can still transfer files at a rate of up to 312 MB per second.

 

Traditional backup methods tend to only allow for one device to be backed up at a time. The Octoplus steps past that old way of thinking. With this device, you can back up as many as 6 devices at once with the 4 USB ports and the 2 internal SSDs, saving you time, energy, and sanity.

 

There’s no such thing as “running out of space” when you have the Octoplus — it offers up to 4 TB of SSD storage! Plus, the device features three USB-C and one USB-A port for any specific drive you need to connect to it. And, if you ever need more space than that, simply switch the Octoplus to “Extend Mode” to double your internal SSD storage (an option that eliminates the built-in redundancy).

 

There’s no reason to ever settle for codecs you don’t want. The Octoplus supports more than 13 codecs in six container formats, and you can even render proxy wherever you are, saving you valuable time.

 

The Octoplus gives you the freedom to lighten your load. With an integrated SD card reader and four extra USB ports (USB-C, USB-A, Thunderbolt 3, and DisplayPort over USB-C), you can pack far fewer dongles and accessories, opening up more space for your creativity.

 

We realize creatives like to do things their own way. That’s why we built the Octoplus with fully customizable buttons — set it up to meet your individual requirements.

 

Every videographer and photographer has their own way of doing things, and no rigid system will appeal to everyone. That’s why the Octoplus was designed with a one-touch backup that can save up to 10 customizable presets. Set it up according to your specific needs.

 

Before the Octoplus copies hundreds of files, its auto-rename function steps into batch rename every file so that they’re easy to understand and identify. The system includes the options you need to create sensical file names, like sequential numbers, unique names, and more. So instead of having to search through meaningless file names like “C001.MOV,” the Octoplus will rename it to something far more helpful, like “[Date][Project Name][Clip Number].MOV”.

 

With its backlit 2.2” LCD, the Octoplus gives you an effortlessly viable display — even in direct sunlight and total darkness. You’ll never have to squint or make brightness adjustments.

 

The Octoplus doesn’t force you to scroll or navigate through endless menus. Instead, all important information is displayed on the outer ring of the display, with four customizable buttons surrounding it.

 

There’s no need to power down when your battery is low — the Octoplus features a removable, hot-swappable NP F-550 battery designed to be compatible with all your other equipment.

  • You can transfer up to 4 TB of data on a single charge, and it only takes 45 to fully charge the battery.
  • Should the battery die on you, the Octoplus will still support the UDF File Management System. This enables it to function like any standard SSD drive would (and with any system).

 

If you want an advanced way to back up your files that is easy and efficient, we need your support. With your help, we can bring this game-changing product to life. So don’t wait until the last minute — back the Octoplus today!

Supporting us is a simple, three-step process.

 

  • Footage Backup with Checksum Demo

​

  • Footage Transcoding Demo

 

  • File Renaming with Preset Demo

​

  • SSD Extend Mode (RAID 1 to Raid0)  Demo

​

  • Battery Hot-swap Demo

​

If you want an advanced way to back up your files that is easy and efficient, we need your support. With your help, we can bring this game-changing product to life. So don’t wait until the last minute — back the Octoplus today!

Supporting us is a simple, three-step process.

Or check out Indiegogo "How do I claim a Perk?" page.

Remember, We offer the lowest price for our backers!

Have any questions? Check out our FAQ page or contact us here.

Thank You!
